description:
So, we have eaten Village Pizzaria pizzas for 9 years now.  Their pizza is by far THE BEST pizza in San Francisco.  Friendly and professional service, they always quote an hour for delivery and it is usually 1/2 an hour and did I mention the pizza??  SUPERB!!

Here's to many more years of eating your fantastic food!
author: Troix W.

description:
Came here after a day of drinking for Cinco de Mayo. The restaurant was empty- so I'm assuming they were planning to close early until my group of 8 walked in lmao 

Service was alright, they were pretty accommodating. 

We ended up ordering an XL of the combo special and then a S afterwards since we weren't full just yet. The pizza was okay, nothing out of the ordinary. I like how the crust is thin and wasn't too overwhelming- bc you know how some pizza places make the crust hella thick and bread-like? 

The only downside to thin crust is that all the toppings fell off as we tried to grab a slice lol 

Glad I got to try this place out but it's def not the first place I would go to for my pizza cravings...
author: Coco L.

description: Hands down BEST PIZZA IN SF!  Reminiscent of New York.  I have been searching for years for pizza like theirs.  Tried the Pesto Penne without the chicken as I don't eat meat and it was superb!  I have their delivery guys deliver and pizza piping hot!  I have never received delivery so fresh and HOT!  Super nice people.  Can't wait til CPMC moves in down the street.  We are going to give them TONS of business!!  Great ambiance too!
author: Lynne P.

description:
After Home Aline movie along with the SF Symphony we just had to get a cheese pizza for the ride home.  We have fond memories of Village in Marina and we are happy that they still are in SF.

We will be back!
author: Wendy C.

description:
Ah, this place brings back memories. When we first moved to SF, we frequented the Village Pizzeria on Clement and Arguello, which is long gone. Now, the Van Ness location is all we have to remember what was great about this SF pizza joint.

I review lots of pizza places, because I'm from Brooklyn where pizza is a religion. Don't get me into a discussion about DiFaro vs. Spumoni Gardens (look it up). Anyway, 30+ years in California has me constantly on the prowl for authentic NYC style 'Za, and I have to say my experience here is pretty good.

The smell is right when you enter the place, garlic and parmesean permeate the atmosphere, along with the gaminess of some of the street people who have scraped up enough for a slice to go. Most recently I was here with my teenage daughter, before seeing a movie at the AMC across the street. I opted for pepperoni, and she, the purist, went for cheese. I have to say we were both quite happy, as the slices were fresh out of the oven, the toppings were adequate without being messy, the slices were foldable, and the oil dripped at just the right rate to make it seem like home.

It is a bit more expensive than I remember from the 90s, but hey, what isn't?  My best advice is when you get there, either have whatever just came out of the oven, or have a pie made custom. The fresher the better!
author: Mike K.

description:
Pros: 
1) you can order a slice & have it customized
2) the regular slice is super thin

Cons: 
1) there is just a hint of sauce smeared on
2) they sprinkle bits of cheese on the slice; don't expect much cheese
3) toppings are small and not that plentiful :(
author: Joanna T.

description: Pizza was delivered swimming in so much grease it soaked through the box and dripped on the floor all the way through the house to the kitchen counter. Inedible!!!!! I used to like their pizzas but never again.
author: Heather b.

description:
Village Pizza is our to-go spot in the neighborhood for years. This family-owned pizza joint brings East Coast pizza and pasta to our beloved SF in a vintage setting (gotta love the Giants gear that they added to the brick-exposed walls).

If pizza by the slice, different kinds of pasta, or regular pub food (chicken wings) - you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Hearty and filling!

Most patrons here are from the surrounding residential buildings, the cinema across the street, and the Holiday Inn. 

Village Pizza also delivers.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
I must have been seriously tripping in 2016 because Village Pizzeria is seriously my new weakness!  Why do you ask???!! Mainly because I am a sucker for anything garlicy, cheesy, and just good as hell!

I haven't had anything from here that was not good, well, the pizza is a tad bit on the greasy side, BUT, the pasta and calzone, my oh my.  Their Alfredo is super creamy with just the right amount of garlic goodness.  The regular size is almost $11, you can add chicken for about $4 more.  I usually opt for chicken-less because the portion itself isn't much.  You also get a roll on the side which is just perfect.  

I believe it was the all meat calzone that I have tried and I absolutely LOVED IT!  I love how delicious they make their dough (bread) because it always taste fresh.  The portion of this bad boy is unbelievable.  Usually after half, I am beyond full.  On the inside they put some sort of garlic sauce inside.  If you aren't a fan of garlic, I would maybe ask them to cut back a little bit.  It would also be nice to see more meat inside.  Some areas, you get more bread than anything else.

I think my only issue with this place is their customer service.  You almost hate to spend $$ with them because the guys behind the counter aren't very personable.  Last week when I asked to have my calzone cut in half, he actually made a really ugly face, as if I was asking too much of him.  At least if youre going to make shi*tty faces, make sure the customer can't see you, maybe?

On average, my co-worker and I don't spend anywhere between $25-$28 at this place and the attitude is definitely not necessary, ESPECIALLY when quite a few times our orders were not right! just sayin!
author: Sabrina J.

description: I used to live across the street from here and it's just as delicious as I remembered it to be. I have only ordered pizza here, they have my favorite little pepperonis and the crust comes out thin and crispy - so good !!
author: Kai L.

description:
This is our go to spot for solid East Coast pizza! Perfect amount of sauce and cheese, and great toppings. It's probably the only spot in the city with GREEN olives. 
Sometimes the wait can be really long, and ya a bit spendy, but I've never had a pizza that wasn't worth it, and I've been going here for 2.5+ years. 

Hands down the best crust in town though. Yeah, better than Tony's.
author: Mike P.

description: The food tasted frozen and not fresh, the pasta had no flavor , and the wings were not cooked well . Definitely do not recommend!
author: Alondra R.

description:
YUM! 

Cheap, quick, and good. This was close to our hotel so we stopped in on a whim and so glad we did!

Pasta was A1 in my books. Maybe because I have been depriving myself of actual pasta :O
author: Sarai M.

description: Great pizza! Local joint, pizza is down to earth New York style. Very similar to being in a north east suburban local pizza joint.
author: Brad R.

description:
8 dollars for two slices of pepperoni pizza and I got was this.. (posted pic) two slices that look dry with barely any cheese. Over cooked. and no effort at all. 

pretty disappointed considering I live a few blocks away and it's a total hit or miss with this place.

Seemed stingy today with the cheese... 

Not going back again.
author: Jae P.

description:
Something is up with this pizza place. I have only eaten their pizza twice, both times there has been a rubber band in my pizza slice. How could this happen TWICE????

My roommate likes their pizza, the first time he offered it to me a year ago I took a couple bites... felt something really chewy and rubbery between my teeth. Pulled it out... RUBBER BAND. So grossed out I didn't eat it for another year.

My friend got their pizza again today. I thought I'd give it another chance... maybe it was a fluke mistake. The pizza itself isn't that bad. First slice was okay...went for a second slice... ANOTHER RUBBER BAND.... I cannot make this up.

You guys need to keep your cooking areas clean and be careful not to add RUBBER BANDS IN YOUR PIZZA. Blech
author: Marie O.

description:
Wow. what terrible customer service. Where do I even begin? I literally order about 20 minutes ago thru grubhub and the shift manager on Friday Feb 2nd at 9:20pm was the most aggressive and unreasonable person I think that I have encountered in my life.

My friend had ordered earlier in the night and when it had arrived we realized that we had miss ordered our pizza and also we had paid for some sauce sides that had not arrived. Acknowledging that we had ordered the wrong pizza I volunteered to re order under my grub hub account and to make sure we would receive the sauce we paid for. When I called to address this the employee that originally answered the phone passed the call to a manager which I was happy to do. When he answered the phone I could not  believe the customer service I would receive of lack there of.

I explained that our previous order was not correct and I would like to make sure that our order that was coming would be and that I would like the sauce we had previously paid for would come with this order. He asked for my address which I gave but also explained that the previous order was under a different name and number. He kept repeating in an angry and aggressive fashion that there was no previous order and that I must have had the wrong pizzeria. I understood but since this is a chain pizzeria I hoped they might understand the situation and I asked that they might fulfill our request and was met with the most anger / aggression I think that I have experienced in my life. He basically said they would not fulfill my order at all even though I said all I was calling for was a conversation about sauce to which he hung up on me. I called back to which he answered the phone directly and called me by my name and he said "DO YOU UNDERSTAND ME?" "DO YOU UNDERSTAND ME? I AM CANCELLING YOUR ORDER AND YOU CAN CALL F****** GRUBHUB TO DEAL WITH IT." Which I did, the customer service rep for grubhub was very kind and I told her what had happen, she put me on hold to call and confirm with the restaurant. When she came back to my call she had obviously also felt a little accosted by the manager on shift. She apologized for how I had been treated and issued a refund and a credit.

While only the refund was required I appreciate how GrubHub handled this and am dismayed at how Village Pizzeria behaved. I am a food service employee at another respected pizzeria in SF and I would never dream about treating any of my customers this way.

DO NOT EAT OR ORDER FROM THIS PIZZERIA, THEY ARE LITERALLY THE WORST.
author: Robin K.

description: Great spot for a quick slice and a beer. I started with a fairly boring pepperoni and mushroom slice, which checked all the boxes for a traditional NY-style slice. Also had a slice of the Chicken Tinga, which was everything I love about tacos on a pizza. Will definitely be trying this on my own next time I make pizza. Good place overall!
author: Alexi V.

description:
We dined in and ordered a medium pizza with sausage and mushrooms while waiting for a tire change at Wheel Works around the corner on Bush.   There were eight slices on this 14" pie.  Service was great as was the pie!  Our server, Travis, was excellent and took good care of us.
The crust was thin and crispy with a nice doughy rim.  I was pleasantly surprised as pizza can be hit or miss in SF.  This would fall in line with what most people would consider a traditional NY pizza.
We were given a free appetizer for checking in on Yelp.  We opted for a side of meatballs with sauce.  The balls were large, cheesy and hot!  The accompanying sauce was simple yet tasty too.
I'm going to remember this place and order take- out when the pizza urge hits again.
Same for the balls.
author: Thomas D.

description:
I don't know where to start. The lady on the phone acted like she had never made a pizza in her life.  She had us repeating our order about 10 times, and the entire process took a good 15 minutes. For a large pizza with sausage and olives, $35 bucks. 

Now the pizza..this is why they get a one star rating. The crust tasted like cardboard, was wet in the middle, dry on the outer edges. The cheese was like plastic and had zero flavor. Sauce was bland, as well. The only decent thing was the sausage. I don't know how such a basic pizza could go so terribly wrong, but it did! I am pretty sure the only way I would ever even TRY this place again is if it were free, and I am usually very forgiving and willing to try new things. I would have had a better meal from Domino's. This was the only damper on our trip to San Francisco, such a pity. =(
author: Shannon G.

description:
Solid slice pizza and salad lunches, the warm sandwiches are really good as they make their own bread.

Parking is pretty easy in the area
author: Gerald S.

description:
I used to come here all the time with my dad before catching a movie across the street. I came here the other night before an event for a quick slice of pepperoni. And man oh man, the pizza is just as good as I remember.

First of all, the slices are huge. One slice here is the equivalent of two slices anywhere else. Prices are reasonable (in the $4-$5 range, depending on what you order). Unlike a lot of pizzerias, these guys bake their slices from scratch. They're not just reheating a slice of cheese pizza and sprinkling a few pieces of pepperoni on top. So you can always count on Village Pizzeria to serve you a slice straight out of the oven. Crisp crust + hot, gooey cheese every time.

It's nice to have a pizzeria you can always rely on. It's def worth a visit if you're wandering around Van Ness.
author: Kevin B.

description: REVIEW: called in Oder a classic pepperoni slice well done the lady that answered the phone was very short and kinda rude but hey some people are just that way came in to pick up my slice and between the guys making the pizza and the staff ringing orders it looked very chaotic and a little ghetto they need to polish up the dining area is decent but the front is a hot mess their customer service is dry and just whatever like just hurry up get your order and go no gretting not welcoming but hey it is what it is no big deal if I'm hungry I'll gladly stop in and get my slice to go but I would never done in!
author: Sac M.

description: We ordered a prosciutto pizza abd it was the worst pizza I have ever had. Stale, impossibly salty, rubbery crust. I bet they reheated an old pizza and delivered it to us. Will never order from this place again.
author: EG P.

description:
I came here one day to grab a slice before I head back to work. They make the slices to order, so I got to pick something rather than choose from a limited selection. I got the Greek pizza, and it was ready in 5ish minutes. This was exactly how long they reassured me it would be, which I appreciated. 

My pizza was a pretty big slice and piping hot! Overall, though, I thought it was a bit pricey for average pizza.
author: Neda S.

description: This place was amazing. We've tasted pizza in New York and Ima have to say this place has that taste and flavor. Got a couple slices of pizzas and a calzone and I was stuffed and really satisfied with the taste of the place. Totally will recommend and try again on another visit to SF
author: Miguel N.

description:
Got a take-out order of two slices combo pizza. Got it home and it was BURNED BLACK on the bottom. Threw the shit out. Dunno if burning stuff black is S.O.P. with this outfit or if it was a one-off fluke. Sure as hell ain't gonna find out. 

Grrrrr.....
author: Bill S.

description: At first glance I assumed this place would be bomb, it just looks like it has an authentic feel, I ordered two slices, one Hawaii and one pepperoni with jalapeños. I ordered to go and when I opened the box, I was very disappointed, the slices were small, and and the toppings didn't look like they were even baked together, it's like they baked the crust and then threw the cold toppings on at the end. Overall I probably wouldn't go again.
author: Eduardo L.

description:
I order online often for work, it's easy to navigate through the ordering screens and customize your own pizzas. We usually purchase around 8 pizzas of different kinds and throw in a pesto one because they are so good. 

They are always on time, although I order them early before they open and have them delivered for lunch They come complete with paper plates, napkins, peppers and parmesan cheese which is good.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Slices baked to order. Crunchy thin crust. Yet no crunchy thin people... hence the 3.5 stars? 

Not your typical post-hipster minimal modern pizza joint. It's older San Francisco, with vintage SF photos and memorabilia on the wall. Had huge slices of hawaiian, sausage & mushroom & green pepper, and pepperoni with mushroom. Saturday night around 7pm, there weren't very many people in there but the staff was really friendly and brought the pizza to our table quickly. 2 sodas and 3 slices coming to $21.05 and providing a very satisfying meal. I would definitely go there again... Village Pizzeria is a refreshing change from the new wave of california-ized overpriced take-some-lowbrow-food-like-pizza-and-turn-it-into-a-thing.
author: Rebecca S.

description: Closest thing to NYC pizza I could find and as a bonus I checked in with yelp before I ordered and got a free appetizer, I chose the meatball parm and it was delicious. Customer service was good and the wait time was not bad at all considering the place was packed. If your an NYC oizza snob like me, you can find a good slice here.
author: Renato F.

description: The worst pizza slice I've ever had reminded me of the pizza that you bake yourself it was paper thin, had so little sauce and even less cheese and I don't know if they got the pepperoni from the mini people or what... the one thing it has plenty of was grease.   My stomach was hurting 5 minutes later.  Save yourself the hassle of expensive horrible pizza and just go next door.
author: Ronde S.

description: Surprisingly decent pie.  I'm from NY and that's a huge compliment.  4 stars.
author: Chase N.

description: Love the pizza go here daily for lunch but thats changing. Sara is completely rude, and no emotion except irritation. I order a slice every day same every time. So Sarah messed up my order and brought out another slice and tried to say it was mine and asked me if i wanted to eat it or have it remade. When i chose remade she hurriedly and seemingly annoyed walked away and i had to wait for another. Im a carpenter with limited breaks this us not okay. It takes a lot to make me write a review but all my coworkers feel the same. Will not be going here anymore.
author: Cameron L.

description:
Okay I'm giving this pizzeria 5 stars!
I was actually debating between 4 to 5 but when I arrived at the restaurant to pick up my order the Asian guy or he might be the owner was super nice! I loved how he appreciates his customer. He was very welcoming and genuine. I was actually surprised because I came there to only pick up my order. I only waited for 5 minutes, usually if I wait for my order the staff wouldn't keep me posted with my food but he updated me with mine and how many more minutes I have to wait. Another plus was he called me by my first name! 

Here's what we normally order:
Clam garlic pizza- My favorite! A lot of garlic and a lot of clam! Very tasty! My Italian boyfriend approves! I asked him which clam garlic pizza is better Tony's Napoletana or Village Pizzeria? He couldn't choose because he said both have their own approach to this dish and both are just super good! I have to agree :)

Buffalo wings- Spicy and hot! Typical buffalo wings, nothing too memorable about this dish. I just wanted to add wings in our order lol

Garlic bread- This they need to improve on. I couldn't taste much of garlic. I know we already ordered a pizza with garlic but I was hoping they could've added more garlic to this bread then it would have been epic! 
Overall, I really like this place and highly recommend it to everyone! I was craving for clam garlic pizza and this place definitely delivers! Consistent and delicious! As a matter of fact as of right now, my mouth feels like I'm craving for it again! My gawd! Writing this makes me hungry! !
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Im from NY -- this is my go to delivery. Sauce is on point. Texture of crust is very very proper. They rarely mess up my order. Their salads are pretty good (green leafy lettuce, homemade dressings).

A lot of the food ordering apps have 100s of pizza options. Village is always consistent. 

Took off a star because outside of pizza and salads (which are the most important) the rest of the menu is meh. Wings are like Tyson buffalo wings you buy at the grocery store and are never that great.
author: Mike P.

description:
In my last day here at San Francisco, I decided to try the pizza here since it originated from I found this place to be pretty average. But the price is pretty high. I came here around 8:00 PM as it was a 10 minute walk from the hotel and the pizzeria here closed at 11:00 PM. Here's my thoughts on the pizza here...

Basic Facts-
- I came here and ordered the "create your own" pizza. I got the 14 inch pizza with pepperoni, homemade meatballs, bacon, pineapple and mushrooms.
- I also got the 10 piece buffalo wings.
- Also one cheesecake for dessert. 

Pros-
- The people working here was pretty nice to me!
- Very unique with the choice to make your own pizza. I liked how I can customized my own pizza here. 
- Order the buffalo wings here. The buffalo wings here is very good but not spicy and hot like I thought it would be. 

Cons-
- In my opinion, I felt like the wait was kind of long. But then again, I did ordered a lot so the wait was around 30 minutes.
- I felt like the pizza was very...average. It didn't really have a distinct taste that made it "different" from every other pizza store.
- Very generous here. I ordered pizza and they gave me plates, forks, etc without me even asking!

Helpful Tips-
- Make sure to check into Yelp when you get here. You get a free appetizer if you check in!
author: Ashley Z.

description:
Found this pizzeria while walking out of a concert at the Regency Ballroom, and I most say it was a great find. Very attentive service and delicious food. 
We had the chicken Caesar Salad and Chicken Supreme Pizza. One of the best caesars I've ever had. The pizza was also yummy. They definitely do not skimp on the toppings. Will definitely recommend.
author: Chesa C.

description:
4 stars for the lovely waitress. Pizza was about average. I got single slice with pepperoni and mushroom. It was a little expensive . Over 5 bucks, although it might be average for area but ive had bigger slices in other joints in san fran. 
 My brother mentioned it was my b day casually and waitress brought a lovely teramisu unexpectedly. That was great. So pizza was soso and other items seemed a little pricey but nice place overall with great staff.
author: Jesse R.

description: Really good lasagne, Caesar salad was decent, service was solid, will defunity be back when we are in the area!
author: Lisa F.

description:
Would give this place --00000 if possible


Orderd for delivery...told 45 minutes..called after 1 hour...attitude of phone person outrageous...his complaints about ball game etc...hung up pn me...second call to cancell order as rude as first..claimed mgr/owner first respondent...this place NO PLACE SPECIAL..many other places to spend your hard owned $...
author: Jacquelyne G.

description: Was not expecting such a fabulous slice in this SF joint on a sleepy Friday afternoon. The vegetable and the Pepperoni (by the slice, baked to order) were fantastic. Packed with flavor, wonderfully crispy thin crust without being dry and with just the right amount of chewiness. Everything tastes fresh and flavorful. Very satisfying and very good value for SF.  Service was fast and friendly
author: Jan K.

description: Fantastic! Love the New York style pizza, & the menu items are great as well. Has a family feel, like an Italian family restaurant should.
author: Barney C.

description: Worst pizza I ever had in the city! I specifically asked for the Hawaiian BBQ Pizza and I received the BBQ chicken pizza without any pineapple.The pizza was drenched in BBQ sauce and didn't have enough cheese. And too top it all off, where's the cheese on my garlic bread? For the amount I paid I would have expected better quality. The only reason I'm giving this establishment one star is because of the Pizza Delivery guy. Never again!
author: Victoria y.

description:
I ordered a pesto bell pepper,mushroom and onion pizza with no red sauce through Grubhub. I was very disappointed in the way the pesto sauce was distributed. The sauce was non existent basicly with very little pesto sauce. I called Gruhub to complain and was told the reason why the sauce was barely on the pizza is because the sauce is thin. What? I've had pesto pizza many times.  THAT is the worst excuse to tell a pizza lover. I have eaten at both locations Clement and VanNess and never had a complaint til now. The only reason I gave the VanNess location 2 stars is because of the underminding of my pizza intelligence. Management didn't want to give credit through Grubhub. Only directly through Village Pizza. I guess I shouldn't complain at least he offered. Still waiting to speak to someone  at this location about my credit. 

It's ashame I only get to write reviews when im really peeved. There are many great restaurants that deserve positive reviews I have been too.
author: La-Rae A.

description: This place is bomb .com absolutely the best pizza parlor in San Francisco we had pizza and their Meat Calzone this time we come here every time we are in SF this is a must try you will not be disappointed
author: Ken D.

description: Three times and your out.... my order has been delivered incorrectly 3x. Their customer service is horrrrrrible. The woman we spoke with refused to give us her name or let us speak with a manager. Not to mention they changed $2.75 for a tiny side of pepperocines. A neighboring place charged $1.50. That's besides the point though, they can't get their orders right, customer service is horrendous and the food is just mediocre anyways.  Def order your pizza elsewhere.
author: Wendi K.

description:
I've been bitten by the Euro 2012 soccer cup fever!

Fine, I know I'm not fooling anyone. I just watch it because I'm in lust with Cristiano Ronaldo!  ;-)

My soccer loving friend and I parked ourselves directly in front of their flat screen TV to watch England vs. Italia quarterfinals. We stayed here for a good 3 hours!  The Meatlover's pizza kept us full way into overtime.  Piping hot, hand spun thin crust pizza that's cheesy, but a bit greasy (because there are LOTS of meat!) it's everything that a reliable pizza should be.  BTW, Village Pizzeria has been dishing up goodies since 1979.

You can also order pizza by the slice -- try their BBQ chicken, it's chock full of deliciously coated, tender meat!  One serving is more than enough.  Don't forget to get a side of garlic rolls, I sprinkled additional granulated garlic and parmesan cheese on mine. Oh, so good!

SF Giant's memorabilia are scattered all over the resto along with some old timey black and white photographs of San Francisco tourist spots. The exposed brick wall adds to the historical feel of the place. 

We got fantastic service from Cassie, thanks for taking care of us! This is a great low key place to enjoy a cold brew and casual eats while watching the game. What more can a girl ask for?

Oh yeah, Cristiano Ronaldo taking his shirt off.
author: Janice C.

description:
Got an XL NY style half and half, one side meatball, the other side italian sausage. Sausage was a little bit on the fatty side, i like leaner sausage with less noticeable pieces of fat in it.

The meatball was great and i reccomend it and would get it again. I've been to NY a couple times and this was on par with the authentic hole-in-the-wall pizza i had there.
author: Brandon H.

description:
Decent Slice from Village Pizzeria

Walking from work to catch a movie at opera Plaza, I'd had Village Pizzeria bookmarked as a potential grab & go spot for a slice & finally got around to giving them a try

1 slice of Cheese Pizza

Slices were largish in size & there was an abundance of stringy-pulling cheese.  Sauce was flavorful & even though this is a NY-Style pizza & I usually prefer the thicker crust varieties, I found myself liking this slice a lot

Thanks for the quick, on the go snackie!
author: Adrienne G.

description: We stopped in right before heading to a concert across the street and were pleasantly surprised by how good the pizza and garlic bread was from Village. We would come back if we were in the area again!
author: Ashley F.

description:
Great pizza - and also delivers for $2... 
I try to find an excuse to call in here and have a beer while I wait for my pizza!
author: Andrew C.

description:
Great place for pie after a concert, especially when you've been walking ALL day. Great pie and service! With my girl after the KAM Show at the Masonic.

Want a great, late Sunday night, after your kids just went to a concert pizza, this is your place.
author: Irvin N.

description: I'm a HUGE pizza lover! And my boyfriend & I did a trip up to San Francisco, right after we checked in at our hotel (at The Payne Mansion Hotel -- amazing place!)...we were super hungry & Village Pizzeria was the first place we went to in SF. Great pizza! I love that they have a build your own slice option! I've never seen that before haha (usually by the slice you can only get cheese or pepperoni). Nice classic pizza joint vibe, good beer options too! Loved this place :)
author: Caity C.

description:
First just want to clarify that 1 free appetizer means not any appetizer and yes small salad or garlic bread.

Today it was raining and I ordered pepperoni pizza (8pcs allows you to get the free appetizer) plus buffalo wings. I called to make the order at 6:46 pm and the pizza was delivered by 8:25. It was  cold and the old guy delivering was not friendly at all. 
I would not order from here again just because they said that the delivery was gonna take maximum 1hour and the pizza was totally cold :P  my boyfriend was also not pleased :( 
The cost of all plus tip was almost 40 bucks.
author: Kim K.

description: Very good pizza, calzones and Stromboli! The place was kind of empty, but the food and service were very good.
author: Rick D.

description:
Not sure where to start. Pizza was underwhelming and undercooked, order was missing pepperoni and other items which we had  requested, and lady on the phone was rude and hung up on us when we told her that our order fell short of expectations.

Lots of great pizza joints in SF - we'll make sure to take out business elsewhere.
author: M K.

description: Got the mushroom and olive pizza with sausage on half. The crust was perfectly crispy outside, spongy on the inside, and just thin enough under the toppings. I don't usually eat the crust on pizzas because it usually isn't really that good, but this time my date and I wiped out the whole damn thing. Couldn't stop eating, it was a very pleasant surprise to find legit NY style 'za. Waitress was very kind, too, timely service and all. Will be returning soon.
author: Matias C.

description: Wow- post Regency Ballroom show, and we just had the best pizza ever. It was absolutely amazing. Highly recommend the Greek pizza.!!!
author: Tracie P.

description: Good pasta but ridiculously overpriced. Spaghetti with meat sauce and a soda for $17. GTFO.
author: MakeUp M.

description: Good pizza! Hispanic guy is cool but lady during the week is a bipolar BITCH. But the slices are great.
author: Julius S.

description:
The pizza itself was pretty good. A little soggy and pepperoni very small over overall had tasty flavors and was crunchier towards the crust.

Do not buy pizza by the slice here. I paid 14$ for 2 slices of pizza. 

When I inquired the manager tried to explain the exorbitant price with a slough of excuses. "It's a special type of pizza you can't find anywhere else." "This is actually a good deal for San Francisco." "Pesto is considered specialty so automatically we charge 5.50$ per pesto slice. Then we charge you per extra topping" This woman/manager was talking to me as if I haven't lived in SF for the last 10 years and as if I had never had pizza before. The place was deserted. I'm assuming the only way this place has stayed afloat is because of its proximity to the Regency. Kudos on taking advantage of a bunch of drunken fools seeking a late night greasy snack.

As I sit here eating the pizza right now I can confidently say I won't be back. Good luck Village Pizzeria, you're gonna need it...
author: Erronious M.

description: Yeah so I went here with a couple friends who'd been here before and they liked it so we decided to come back and try it again. I got the chicken calzone and side salad. Both were very good, though it was pretty expensive, which is why I only gave it 4 stars. Would I be back? Absolutely!
author: JD G.

description: This pizzeria definitely did not own up to their sign that read 'fresh slices made to order'. I ordered two slices and watched the guy grab the trays of pizza that were sitting on top of the stove and take two slices and heat them up for about a minute. Nothing fresh about this place. Btw the pepperoni pizza is really oily
author: Henry A.

description:
While not fancy pizzas they sure don't seem cheap quality either. I liked the garlic roll as appetizer, basically garlic bread as a bun? but it's good to start - with a beer (Newcastle!) of course. My favorite pizzas here are the not too sweet nor too salty bbq pulled pork and bbq chicken. The menu is quite extensive.

The place is family-run so I did notice a more familial atmosphere than the typical pizza joint, and the walls are adorned with local sports teams, especially our Giants and Niners! I think this place should be fun to go watch games, well any sports really, and should be more so during the upcoming MLB playoffs, yeah!

This pizzeria is right on Van Ness and I never noticed it whenever driving through the area. I would stop by often if only was living closer, but then again one can order online and there's a mailing list for offers too.
author: Peter L.

description: I've had their pizza, meatballs, garlic rolls, garlic bread (for comparison) and the home made brownie. The only thing of the list I'd say I enjoyed, would be the meatballs and garlic roll. Reason for that is because everything else is basically the same quality you can get anywhere. The prices are pretty high up there for a pizza joint, and the customer service could use some work. I can't comment on the quality of the place itself hygiene-wise, but I guess it's so-so. Can't complain for a fast paced eatery in this area.
author: Tricia M.

description:
I've had thousands of pizza places, here in the states and in Italy, and Villa Pizzeria is one of the worse.

The food - I tried the $5.50 per regular sized slice (very expensive, even for the area) clam and garlic slice and it DISAPPOINTED. The clam was almost impossible to eat, overly chewy and the garlic was nowhere to be found. The crust was cardboard-y. Yuck. The combo slice $4.75 was boring as well. Lacked any depth or flavor. At least both were made to order, but I would have rather have Little Caesar's.

Service was friendly, but doesn't tell you if you need to seat yourself or wait for them to be seated. They also somehow forgot I already ordered when I went to pay despite having sat in front of them for 20 mins trying to eat my horrible pizza. At least they did have NFL network showing the football game.

I won't be back. If it wasn't for a storm, I had 100 pizza options within walking distance that could have been better.
author: Chuck N.

description:
A friend and I came in and ordered a medium pizza, half cheese and half pepperoni. We also got the garlic bread as our appetizer. The garlic bread came pretty quickly and you get a decent amount, but it was burnt. It seems like it could've been decent, but it was crunchy in areas yet soggy in some, and most of the edges and bottom were black. Then came our pizza. Again, portions are nice. But just like the bread, the pizza was burnt. The pepperoni slices were small and there weren't that many. The entire pizza was pretty soggy and greasy too. I was even disappointed with my Arnold Palmer.

Our bill came out to be $32. Mind you that my appetizer was free because I had the check-in coupon for a free appetizer. $32 for one medium pizza and an Arnold Palmer. Seems a bit steep. Which it was because the medium pizza was supposed to be $22, but we were charged almost $26.

I will not be back here.
author: Alyssa N.

description:
We stopped into the Village before a show at the regency. Wasn't expecting much but was pleasantly surprised. Good thin crust pizza with a little chewiness to the crust that I really liked. Fresh toppings and ample amounts of cheese. 
Local Anchor Steam on tap was the perfect match for our combo pie. 
The service was very business like, which for us was all good.
So when we are back for a show at the regency we will defiantly be back for a beer at the very least.
author: Matt B.

description: a really overall great pizza place! I went yesterday with a friend of mine and we ordered some cheese pizza that was amazing, I like the thin crust and it for the most part came out really really quick! the workers are really nice and I am definitely coming back !
author: Emily M.

description: Being from the east coast I am always looking for a good "slice" and I found it here ! Not only was I impressed on how I could fold my slice but the option to put anything I wanted on my two slices. I will definitely be back when I am back n San Francisco.
author: Daniel W.

description: Very impressed. I was touring in San Francisco these past few days with my husband, my cousin and her husband on our mission to Crooked Street we saw they had pizza by the slice which was perfect cause we just wanted a snack so we walked in and ordered one slice with pepperoni.  It was really good! I couldn't get over it.  The next day I actually contemplated driving back to this pizzeria before driving back home and ordering a whole pizza to go.
author: Cat B.

description:
My husband and I live a few blocks away from this pizzeria and we decided to give it a try.

This was absolutely the WORST PIZZA I have ever had in my life. I feel completely ripped off. I know mediocre pizza and I appreciate it's existence. This pizza is not mediocre. This pizza is BAD. I literally couldn't finish my first slice it was so awful. It tasted like a disk of raw garlic and gristle that someone had used as an ashtray. A $30 ashtray. 

I literally live 3 blocks away and yet the pizza did not arrive until an hour and a half after I ordered it... and it arrived cold. How exactly does a pizza get cold in the space of 3 blocks? I don't know... but they somehow managed it. I assume it sat in their store for about an hour of that hour and a half delivery time. 

We will NEVER order pizza from here again. Back to our tried and true Extreme Pizza.
author: Erin R.

description: Good pizza !!! Very friendly staff will make you feel at home. Try the BBQ Pork pie !
author: D H.

description: Their Pizza is so good and so is their chicken pesto pasta. Yum Yum!
author: Michelle E.

description: Came here on Tuesday pretty late at night, it wasn't busy so we sat down & placed our order. Got our food & drinks really quickly & it was delicious! Super cheesy, so much so it stretches in every bite. Overall really good late night pizza.
author: Iris V.

description: I was skeptical about going to this pizzeria. We ordered the whole Sicilian pizza with Salami, pepperoni, mushroom and extra cheese.  I was thrown back out of San Francisco and back in time. Great pie .
author: Juan V.

description:
I sometimes come here after the gym when I get super hungry. I came here twice and usually I just get a slice of pizza for a decent price.

if you eat here, service is REALLY nice and takes good care of you. 
The pepperoni and combo slices are both really good! The only thing I dont like is the crust. Yes its thin, which I like ( dont want to eat more carbs ) but the crust is really hard to cut. I don't like to get my hands dirty, especially when i eat pizza, so i cut it as if it were steak. It was so hard to cut, but overall I'd like to come back again :)

OH YEs, I LOVE Tiramisu so I suggest their tiramisu there.
author: Josie D.

description:
I actually like this place. It has good ol' simple pizza (please note i only had their village special which is like a supreme pizza). Enough with all these fancy pizza places around SF. Sometimes you just need a normal, reliable, simple pizza. Can't go wrong with Village Pizzeria!

Also, everyone here is super nice! Definitely will order here again if I ever just need some standard pizza.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Excellent pizza! Nice thin crust cooked to perfection and good size slices!! Will come here again for happy hour.
author: Daniel C.

description: Perfectly adequate pizza restaurant, which has been around over 30 years. Pleasant service, and reasonably priced.
author: Jethro B.

description: BITE OF BACON is a must try. Hands down best slice of pizza I've had. Don't get the wings. They don't make them. They come from the freezer and put in the oven. Took one star off because the waiter gave us no attention.
author: Mariko D.

description:
This place I thought would be cool to eat at. But, I have a friend who is severely allergic to MSG (monosodium glutamate). So, I called them and asked if they had MSG in their product. The man shot me down in a matter of seconds claiming that they didn't have MSG. Naturally, I asked them again because when I say my friend is allergic I really mean it, migraines for days, just sitting in bed it hurts so much. This man then replied, fine if you don't, believe me, I'm not even going to try to sell it to you go find another place to eat and just hung up on me. Excuse me, could you say that again, that is the rudest thing I have ever heard. 

I still ended up ordering the pizza online just to see if he was telling the truth. And what do you know, I believe it has MSG. The pizza was salty (one sign for MSG), definitely nothing fancy and honestly I have had way better pizza. Go somewhere else, this place isn't worth your time nor money.
author: Nicole J.

description:
Finding a good slice in San Francisco is difficult.  SF does whole pies well at some places but an individual slice in my experience is usually pretty bad.

Happy to have found village and can say that their by the slice as well as pies are fresh, well made and in general pretty awesome.
author: Adam D.

description: I liked the pizza. We got a pesto cheesy pie and free garlic bread thanks to the yelp offer. I also got a slice of the lemon cello cake. The delivery came in about 40 minutes and it was super. We'll order from here again.
author: michelle D.

description:
Good service. Great food with large portions.

The dining room is noting much to look at.

Very friendly and fast service.  I'd definitely go back to this place if I was in the area.
author: Ryan I.

description:
Ok let's start this off by saying that I'm not over-picky when ordering late night. My usual places were closing so I gave this one a try. I can't honestly tell you if the half and half pizza I ordered is any good because it was made so hurriedly with much indifference.  

First of all it was not made 50/50. It was more like 60/40 and the grease was not drained along with the toppings being unevenly splattered randomly. The cheese was barely existent and the pizza had been probably tipped sideways making a further mess. Not much more to say except I will make sure not to spend 37.00 for a pizza here in the future.
author: Dale M.

description:
Ok if you're on the run.

The pizza is nothing special. Seems like they make a base cheese and then add whatever toppings people order at the end (allowing them to let you customize your toppings). 

Cute shop. Kid friendly. Prices are reasonable.
author: Amy L.

description: Based on *many* deliveries I can say that they are consistent and have good pizza.  Sometimes a bit soggy but that's to be expected for delivery.  2 minutes in the toaster oven and it's yummy again.
author: Darrin C.

description:
Village Pizza has been a favorite of mine for most of my lifetime.  I have visited since I was a little kid, and they are my 'preferred' delivery option in my area.  However- the key to Village Pizza is ordering their THICK CRUST "Sicilian" pizza.  If you order the "Neapolitan" thin crust, you will have a very 'ordinary' slice of pizza- decent but nothing special.

The Sicilian, however, is the best in its class in SF.  You can order these by the slice at the restaurant, or in 'half' (six slice) or 'whole' (twelve slice) pizzas.  The slices are rectangular in shape, approximately 3/4" thick, and have a great crisp to the them.  Two slices fills me, three puts me in food coma- but they taste so good its hard to resist. My personal favorite is ordering a Sicilian with extra cheese, pepperoni, and pesto/tomato sauce mixed, and cooked "well done".  Ask for a little basil on top too-  you will be a fan for life if you order this.

While there are many many many pizza options in SF, some trendy, some dive-ish- Village maintains the old-school pizzeria feel with consistently good food.  They do the thick crust better than anyone, and I hope you give them a try and enjoy the goods!
author: Andy S.

description:
Full disclosure, we live near Village so it has become a staple for us. Proximity aside, LOVE this place. You can order custom pizza slices or whole pizzas if you like. BF and I usually get our own slices and split a Caesar Salad. 

Also, they have a FANTASTIC happy hour which makes going out all the more affordable. Good beers on tap and some wine options. Pizza slices discounted during happy hour too (2-6 p.m.). 

You can ALSO score a free appetizer by checking in via Yelp. Highly recommend you check it out. And stuff your face.
author: Amanda E.

description: Sicilian pizza is excellent!   Friendly service.  Done take out and dine in here for years.
author: Derek J.

description: Great service. The create your own calzone was delicious and the garden salad was fresh.
author: Gloria H.

description: the pizza here use to be way better it is not good now.we use to like the garlic rolls, but not enough to pay for greasy, oily no cheese pizza . the quality has gone way down .will not be ordering from here anymore .one medium pizza with added mushroom for $1.50 for $24 1 bottle of soda and 2 rolls for $40.00 with tip is way too much !!! oh my husband usually eats 3 or 4 slices of all pizzas he barely ate 1 slice. so that says it all.
author: Nellie J.

description:
I LOVE this pizza place. One of the best delivery pizza places in SF hands down. Great quality pizzas and salads. I am obsessed with their basic cheese pizza and their  house salad with their homemade vinaigrette! Strong garlic and basil notes. Love this with their house salad as well as dipping my pizza in it! YUM!

Good prices and LOVE that they take credit card.

GO here! Now :)
author: Whitney S.

description:
I love this place, when I feel like treating myself to quality pizza, I put in an order on their website and get prompt reliable service. 

I've definitely treated myself to one too many slices these days, but you can't go wrong with any of their pizzas!
author: Alli J.

description: This place has pretty average pizza, although it's been a while since i've been there i remember the staff being pretty nice.
author: Michael E.

description: The pizza is so good and also the service was amazing. I really recommend. It was fast and inexpensive.
author: Norberto S.

description:
I will not be returning here. The only reason this place got two stars is because the amigo behind the food bar gave me a free ranch under the table. Whoopee.  

First our waitress didn't know how much toppings were on their slices, nor did she know how much a single serving of ranch is. And to add icing on the cake we ate at the restaurant, she gave us a small to-go 1 1/2oz cup filled with ranch which turned out to cost .50 cent each. While the one the gentlemen gave us was served in a glass 5oz dipping dish for free. 

On top of that while we were waiting another customer came in and asked a different waitress a question about the pizza and she didn't know. So he said thanks and walked right out. 

My friend ordered a slice of pesto and I ordered a slice of pepperoni, we both shared the garlic bread. The garlic bread came and looked good. But sadly half the bread was more cheesy and the other half was more garlicky. 

Not to long later I got my pepperoni slice. Sweet! I don't touch my slice because I'm waiting for my friends slice. Ten minutes pass no slice. They finally see the order ticket and start making her slice, keep in mind I placed the order and put it all on the same bill. It took almost 20min for her slice to finally come, at that point my slice was cold but I was at ease because if the free ranch. 

I won't be returning here unless I have no choice.
author: Louis C.

description: This place is the only reason I don't mind going to visit my doctor's office across town. Village Pizzeria is just around the corner. I don't have pizza too often, but when I do, I prefer it to be crisp (but not crunchy) on the underside and softer on the top, which is what I find here. Fresh ingredients, never soggy, never greasy, reasonable prices, and made-to-order not-precooked slices, all set in a brownstone shop with cool tall ceilings. I definitely recommend stopping by Village Pizzeria.
author: Elle J.

description: Exactly what we needed. Great pizza,  excellent service. Convenient location.  That simple.
author: Vadim R.

description: I order from here because its close to the house. I havent been impressed with pizza in SF in general so I just go for what's fast. I must say the last two times we ordered from Village we were very happy with the results. Not sure if they got a new line chef but its been tasting better than usual. Plus they have tinga.
author: Drew Z.

description: Village Pizzeria was suggested to us by an SF native.  We took the chance and WOW, its serves some awesome pizza!  The only reason for the 4 star review was the service.  We visited two different times and had to get up and go the counter to get beverage refills and extra napkins during each visit. I did notice that most customers ordered to go rather than eat-in.
author: Jesse A.

description: I hate leaving bad reviews. I live in LA and come to SF often for work. I ordered a cheese pizza and a 2 liter of soda from here, excited to find a pizza place that delivered late. I ordered at 10:45, and got a phone call at 12:15 asking me for directions. Not being from here, I had no idea where he was talking about, and he said it would be another 15 minutes (assuming he could find it.) I had paid more than I'd like to for something as basic as a cheese pizza, but I also paid a delivery fee... to wait 2 hours for my food. The pizza wasn't hot and had clearly been sitting for awhile. I don't need to go into details, but I will say that I won't ever order from here again and I will be calling for a refund in the morning.
author: Matthew M.

description:
Put in an order for a pie via eat.com and were quoted 45-60 minutes. It took closer to 90 minutes and kinda sucked since a) we were starved and b) it was getting really late.

Nonetheless, the pizza was tasty and arrived hot. We got the Village Special with homemade meatballs and sausage, pepperoni, onions, green peppers, mushrooms, black olives. 

+Tasty? Yes.
+Pricey? Maybe. (I don't order pizza that often.) Is $20 for a medium pie expensive?
(Reminds me of Lucille in Arrested Development: "How much could a banana cost? Ten dollars?")
+Would I order again? Probably not, especially given the wait time.
author: Adena B.

description:
My made-to-order slice had the dried-out and reheated quality of frozen pizza. I think they took a slice of not-really-NY-style cheese pizza and then melted the extra toppings over top at too low of a temperature.

I think this is why you don't really see made-to-order slices that often.
author: Craig D.

description: They charge $2 for a bag when they deliver without a bag (pizza box only). When I asked the delivery guy about this he said 'ask the manager'. I would have overlooked this if my $30 large 2 topping pizza was good, but it was bland and unimpressive. I'll go elsewhere next time.
author: Kevin M.

description:
1.  Easy to order via Grubhub.com

2.  Delivery - There is no delivery fee.  Order placed at 8:01 PM.  Order delivered at 8:37 PM.  36 minutes is pretty quick.  The delivery person was professional and polite.

3.  Order Minimum - Relatively Low ($15).

4.  Prosciutto and Tomato Pizza - Particularly on one side of the pizza, the crust was very soggy.  It was difficult to eat the pizza.  The flavors were very good.  The sauce was very tangy.  I enjoyed the salty prosciutto,  Th tomatoes were fresh.  The crust had a nice yeasty flavor.

http://tinyurl.com/3jul6wf

5.  Prices -  Not on the bargain side but not exorbitant.

1  Medium 2-Topping Pizza  $ 18.50
2  12 oz. Can of Soda  $ 3.00
Subtotal  $21.50
Tax  $2.04
Total  $23.54

6.  Overall, if the pizza crust had not been too soggy, this would have been a very good bordering on great pizza.  The delivery was fast.
author: Mark D.

description:
I don't understand the comparisons to NYC pizza .... and I can't say that I'm super discerning but I do know pizza that I like.
This was a very standard pizza for SF -- fair crust, little sauce, not interesting cheese or toppings. 
Of course I doctored it up and actually toaster-ovened it prior to eating -- and it's STILL fair.

I was told that the sausage is home made. I didn't get that particularly. 

On a rainy Saturday afternoon, I walked in to buy a carry out. I was greeted nicely. I ordered efficiently. I got my pizza within 15 minutes. All good. And I tipped -- even though I was carrying out and all she had to do was walk up to me. 

I think it's nice to do that. It sets a good stage...

The pizza I carried home had enough cheese on it. Maybe, probably not enough "home-made" sausage. The dough was fair to poor ...

All in all, fair-ish pizza. Not bad. Not good.
author: Yasi S.

description: Would prefer to leave no stars !! The pizza sucks and the customer service is not existent!!
author: John H.

description: Ordered the Village Special large to go, about $27. Pretty good taste but I don't think the crust is New York Style, too thick. Not bad though, I'd order here again. The menu is pretty extensive and lots of choices. Oh I did love the pesto garlic bread.. yum!
author: Vol T.

description: it's good for a quick slice but i probably wouldn't order food from here if i'm looking for a particularly delicious slice of pizza. it's conveniently located and gets the job done.
author: Tushar K.

description:
What a terrible experience. I placed an order for delivery and received a quote of 45-50 minutes. Get a call back an hour later telling me it's gonna take another 30, ok, fine, just get me my pizza, I'm hungry. Then I receive another call telling me that they are just gonna cancel my order.

Now since I've waited over an hour at this point, most of the decent places nearby are already closed. Thanks Village Pizzeria!
author: Dan T.

description:
Good pizza by the slice options. Very friendly service. Had the prosciutto and esta feta. Both nice options. 
When we walked in I didn't know what to expect but we left happy and full.
author: Arik H.

description:
Welcoming committee.

Immediately upon walking in you are greeted with a smile and a menu. Nice people.

Immediately after talking a bite of the grilled chicken sandwich with marinara sauce on homemade bread you are greeted with culinary pleasure. Nice sandwich.

Small green salad on the side.

Had this been an eight dollar sandwich we'd be talking four stars.

But it's two dollars more, so it's also one star less.
author: Jason B.

description:
One of the worst customer service experiences I've ever had. Ordered two slices to go, and didn't tip because I had to wait so long for anybody to help me (and I wasn't eating there). The man who rang me up then showed my signed receipt to the other two guys working, and I didn't even get eye contact from that point on. I've worked in several customer service industries, including a restaurant, so I am always happy to tip when I'm receiving good service.
What's more, the pizza kinda sucked.
author: Peter N.

description: I went to Village Pizzaria last Sunday night, and the service and pizza there was so great I had to write my first restaurant review!  We were a group of 14 with teens and chaperones.  One girl in the group has a severe nut allergy so I was a bit nervous and called ahead.  The guy that answered was very obliging in answering all my questions.  Their sauce and dough are both made in-house, so they were careful to check everything (including the flour) when asked.  It was the best pizza I ever had (the pepperoni was amazing) along with the best service, not even counting the care they put in making sure the teen would be fine eating there!  The staff was genuine, kind, and attentive, and I will definitely be coming again!
author: Ceci K.

description:
What I hate is people that say they have a delivery service when they don't.......  When I order a delivery it's usually because I want to eat sometime soon not in a few hours.  Ordered at 4.17 on a Thursday night, grub hub said the order would be an hour.  It's now 5.50 and no sign. 

What are the delivery times like on a Saturday night?!
author: Harriet P.

description:
Normally I would have given this place about 4 stars since the pizza is pretty good and consistent.  However, the last 2 times I have ordered for delivery, I used their Internet ordering system and have been very disappointed.  

The first time it was a little late, but since we have ordered from them several time, I just shrugged it off.  This last time however, it took 1 hour and 40 minutes to get my order.  When I called in at the 65 minute mark to follow up, the guy said that I had ordered it 30 minutes ago.  However, I ordered it right before I left work and printed out the confirmation at 7:29PM.  Mind you this was a normal Thursday night with not much going on in the city.  When I mentioned to the guy that I ordered at 7:29PM, he literally said, well I'm not sure what to tell you.  No apologies.  Nothing.  Pizza came delivered at 9:09PM.  When I got it, it tasted like it had sat around for awhile.

Not sure what happened.  I can understand some mishap, but at least don't make me feel like I did something wrong when calling in to your business for something that I paid for.

Honestly, its probably going to be awhile before I order from Village again.  There are too many other places I can choose to spend my money.
author: Jeremy G.

description: Reminds me of the pizza parlors back in Philly. Hand tossed and made to order. Crust tastes excellent. Loved the rolls made from pizza dough. Was here two times had same waiter very friendly guy.
author: Sari P.

description:
LOVE the pizza here!  So tasty.  And the combinations they have?!  BRILLIANT!  Freakin' pizza geniuses.  The BBQ Pork specialty is fantabulous, as is the clam and garlic getup.  Très magnifique!

Did take a small group here once (four people) and had some pretty poor service - the waitress clearly didn't know what she was doing.  Two weeks later I ordered pizza to be delivered, and the bad waitress was the deliverer.  HA!  Busted down to delivery gal!  That's what poor performance gets you, lady.

They do drink specials and a happy hour - cheap pitchers of beer when you buy a whole pie, that sort of thing.  The rest of their menu is pretty good, too - calzones and pasta and such.  Good size portions.

Because of all that, Village Pizzeria is my go-to pizza place in this neighborhood, and also a great casual eating option with friends.
author: Zack B.

description: I'm absolutely shocked - this place refused to deliver unless I came out of my apartment to meet them a the curb. The surly delivery person said I was "lazy" when I suggested places that he could park to deliver. I didn't think he would actually follow-through with it, but he actually took off without delivering. I tried to call the restaurant, but there was no response. I have not received a refund, and frankly, I'm not sure if suffices; having the expectation set up that you will receive a delivery, and then not receiving it is more costly than the value of the food. Truly a terrible experience getting pizza delivery - and I don't really have that many expectations of something so simple.
author: Alvin Y.

description:
I've eaten at and ordered pizza from Village Pizzeria for years, mostly due to the proximity to my apartment. The pizza is fine, although my favorite pizza is from BaoNecci and Tony's Pizza Napolitana - both of whom serve authentic Italian pizza and neither of whom deliver.

The last two times I've called to order pizza from Village Pizzeria have prompted me to think about not giving them my business any more. Once I called and the female owner answered (I know her voice after all these years). Before I had a chance to say much, she told me that I needed to get a life and quit calling repeatedly. Although I tried to explain that I wasn't who she thought I was, she kept telling me to find something better to do and quit calling. When I asked (just to clarify) if it was Village Pizzeria, she said that it was Round Table Pizza and that Village Pizzeria had closed. Aside from that incident, when going in to pick up my order, she is, by turns, nice or dismissive, depending on the day.

On my most recent call, one of the cooks answered my call (I know their voices, too). As I placed my order, he kept asking me to repeat things. Then when I repeated something without his prompting, he said "I CAN hear you!"

So their pizza is alright, but their customer service is sorely lacking. The male owner is incredibly nice, though.  Too bad he doesn't work all the time and that his customer service doesn't rub off on the other employees.
author: K W.

description: Sit down pizza by the slice. Came for lunch. Had the 10.99 lunch special of a slice, salad and drink. It came out quickly, has a thin crust, prompt service.
author: Amy C.

description: Check in to yelp to get a free appetizer - choice of meatballs OR garlic bread. Try the clam & garlic pizza!  The strong bold flavors of this particular pizza blends & balances perfectly well. This joint definitely dishes out NY style pizzas where is this so thin & crispy. They also make their pizzas as you order.  I just ordered a slice of pizza which was $4.50..and it was bigger than my face!  The server was friendly and interactive. It didn't take long for us to get our order and did have very recommendations about the hip joints to check out in SF.
author: Ezzy C.

description: Their garlic cheesy bread is so good, you must dine-in to try it and enjoy the loaded cheese that stretches as you pull a piece off.
author: Kirstin K.

description:
I like this place, mostly because they're avid Giants fans, obvious by the memorabilia all over the original brick walls.  Three TV's showing seasonal games keeps me interested while waiting for the food. 

The pizza is always good.  It's not gourmet, thank God!!  Just cheese, favorite toppings on a decent crust.  The Cesar salad with grilled chicken is one of my favorites.  The dressing is really good.  Try the Calzone if you like that sort of thing or the meatball sandwich if you're in the mood for some good meatballs on really great bread.

I must say that the service is usually pretty good, although getting the servers attention can be a real chore at times, as they tend to hang in the back area for some reason. 

I've never ordered for delivery so I won't comment on that.   If the service was better, they'd get five stars.  Overall, good food, nice ambiance, fair service and a little pricey.
author: Steve C.

description: Very good pizza reminded me of a place back home thin crispy crust excellent taste on the sauce not as much as I like on my pizza but more than average, they make slices to order I had pepperoni and mushroom and a plain cheese.  On average price with New York pizza about four dollars a slice I was very impressed and will definitely eat here again.
author: Blake R.

description: This has become my go to spot when I crave something greasy, cheesy, and amazing. It kind of reminds me of some good New York style pizza (East Coast doesn't do much better than the west imo...but they got us on pizza). Village has been great when it comes to delivery, and the pizza is always hot and ready to eat. Make sure to ask for extra toppings because they don't necessarily put a lot on unless you ask!
author: Christen S.

description: Came in for a quick bite before a show, and ordered two individual slices and a garlic roll.  Could do without the garlic roll.  I ordered the BBQ Chicken and the bf ordered the combo slice.  Very delicious and did not skimp on the size/toppings! Would like to come in for a whole pie sometime and relax a bit or order to go!
author: Roya B.

description:
There are 2 huge issues that we had with Village Pizzeria.
1) Delivery Time : Given a window of 45-60 minutes on Sunday night.  1 hour and 45 minutes later they were 'really sorry and on their way'- pizza showed up 2 hours and 5 minutes after ordering
2) Food: The pizza was cold and tasted funny. We also ordered the garlic bread (which smelled fantastic in the foil), but when we took it out, it tasted like spoiled fish, and we threw it out.  The only decent part of the meal was the cheesecake we ordered, and that was definitely not worth $30 or waiting 2 hrs for.
-
We wanted to try somewhere new and it was a huge disappointment.  We won't ever be eating there again
author: Rose H.

description: This was our neighborhood pizza joint. Our first experience was great. However, it was disappointing every other time. For example, the veggies on our veggie pizza weren't cooked at all. Service is not their specialty either, but I will say that when they are on...they are VERY on.
author: Austin K.

description:
I LOVE this pizza. I order it at least once a week. It always tastes the same and is amazing. I love the cheese! I order sides of spaghetti and meatballs for my son and he loves it.   I also get caesar salads here. Try a brownie for dessert, the best! 

Love, love this place.
author: Nicole V.

description:
I am giving this restaurant 4 starts because of their customer service. I ordered delivery, and when it arrived, it was wrong. Somehow the grubhub menu and the restaurant menu doesn't match (beware of this or you'll end up spending $11 for a meal you could cook yourself for $2.50). 

I called to tell them what happened, and the manager said they would send the proper order over, even though it wasn't technically their error. It only took 25 minutes for my correct order to arrive. That, to me, says this place really cares.
author: Lauren S.

description: Delicious house-made vinaigrette on my salad, and the build-your-own single slice deal is REALLY good.  Anchovies, extra sauce and mushrooms...yum!!
author: Morgan T.

description: I really wanted to write a good review about this place because I've been going there for over a year now. I'm not giving this place two stars because of the pizza, because it's actually pretty tasty. Rather, it's the customer service/ delivery. My boss and I had finished a long day of work and figured we'd order some pizza for delivery to save us both the trouble of going home and making dinner. After calling Village SEVEN TIMES with no answer, I thought the best idea was to go over there, order the pizza and have it delivered. Kind of defeats the whole purpose of delivery. Ordering the pizza and paying for it was easy enough. Then the delivery man showed up to where my .....this was the straw that broke the camel's back. He pointed to the receipt in which I had signed off on my credit card, and asked, "Where's the tip?". I explained to him that a tip is optional and in this particular case I felt as if it was undeserved due to me having to WALK OVER to place an order, and the amount of time it took for the pizza to be delivered. He then tried to argue with me and demand a tip. He finally, very aggressively waved me off and spit at the ground in my direction. Never before have I felt so disrespected as a paying customer. Very disappointed!
author: Deena W.

description: I was not impressed with their pizza.  I didn't have anything else, but after waiting for over 15 minutes for two slices they were pretty hard, with not a lot of pepperoni or sauce. I would not go back there again.
author: Matt W.

description:
Checked in here on Yelp and got a free appetizer when I should have checked out!

I'm from New York and we know pizza, not Chicago, not San Francisco or any other place.  New York knows pizza!  That being said.......

The sign outside said that they have been in business since 1978 and I figured "hey, how can you go wrong?" which means I still have a lot to learn about signs and the bull they convey.

Turns out that the 2 meatballs they gave me for an appetizer was waaaayy better than the pepperoni pizza slices they gave me.  First of all, they pizza was so oily that they should have given me a couple of slices of dough and poured a quart of Pennzoil on my lap. Folks, it's way too oily!  Exxon doesn't have that much oil.  After the slices came, the waitress (who was nice to us) went off and started to have a full blown conversation with two guys from out of town.  Oh geez?  Really?  Come on girl and get back to working the tip?!?!   Thankfully the old guy behind the counter noticed that I was trying to suck the ice cubes through the straw and offered me a refill.  

All in all, next time I'm gonna be much better off buying Domino's pizza and having it delivered to the room.  Same type of heartburn for both places but Domino's is cheaper and I can eat that misery without leaving the hotel room.
author: Michael D.

description:
I ordered 10pcs Buff wings, a slice of pizza and garlic bread with cheese. 

HORRIBLE WINGS. They were the worst. Grocery store frozen aisle wings are probably better than these. Garlic bread was bad as well. However the slice of fresh pizza they made was delicious.
author: Lydia C.

description:
DO NOT GO OR GET DELIVERY FROM HERE!!!!

I read the Yelp reviews, and I thought, balancing not-so-prompt service for pretty good food is okay with me.. their sicilian pizza sounded really good.

Huge mistake. The pizza was bad- so salty it made my lips burn, and the four corner pieces were at least half inedible, so burnt and impossible to chew without first dipping in water. But the people were TERRIBLE. Not like mediocre service bad. Like truly mean spirited.

To start off, on their website it advertises signing up for their email list will get you an immediate coupon. I signed up, confirmed in my email.. it's been 5 days and I haven't gotten a coupon yet. So don't bother with that.

Second, when you order online like I did, it says you can request free parmesan and hot pepper packets. I'd advise against this, as there was a mysterious item on my receipt titled "charge" of $1.50 that I suspect was the result of asking for those little packets, as the only other thing I ordered was the pizza.

Third, they promise to call to confirm your order when you submit online. I waited for the call to ask about the estimated delivery time--but alas when I spoke to someone at the restaurant he promptly shouted that they received my order and hung up on me. I looked at my phone: the call was 4 seconds long. It seems they make a habit of doing that to customers.

It was a bad experience but I thought I would cut my losses. Unfortunately, it's not over. Today the charge appeared on my card statement as $10 over the amount I signed for. I thought the courteous thing would be to give them a chance to correct their mistake. When I called they were obviously unhappy to have to speak to a customer, and the manager first told me he didn't have access to my records but then pulled up my last order and told me that the charge was because I had ordered garlic bread. I neither ordered nor received garlic bread--and even if I had it doesn't cost $10. As I was politely explaining the situation, the manager said "You'll have to talk to your bank" and abruptly hung up on me. Again.

If you must go here, pay in cash because you can't trust them with your card information. Order extra pizza if you are counting on the whole thing being edible. And for goodness sakes don't expect any customer service conversations to be longer than 0:04.
author: Ashley L.

description:
Came in on Monday May 28th, 2012 - Memorial Day around 7:30 and found a seat at the bar. The place was pretty crowded - and it took about 10 minutes for a server to come and take my order.

I immediately ordered instead of waiting - as I didn't know when, Lisa R (server per check) would come back. I ordered the Veggie Calzone - which was an extremely large portion for $12.95 and a Diet Coke. Food was ok - typical Cysco Product which meant average run of the mill items. When my order came out - the cook brought it over as I was sitting right by him - however i had to go find silverware as no one brought any out.

Overall, the waitress was working extremely hard - and was just understaffed. Her section was probably 14 tables with all of them leaving at the same time to see The Roots at the Regency Ballroom. Honestly, I am not sure if i'd come back.
author: Brian D.

description: Loved the old pictures and the high ceilings.  Waiter was best one on the trip so far and was extremely friendly.  Wasn't very kid friendly, but none of SF is really.  Pizza was ok coming from a new Yorker.  Sweeter marinara, mushrooms were fresh, and the bottom did crunch.   The Caesar was great, but nothing blew me away that I would not try another pizza joint if I returned.  However, it is good and my family was happy.
author: Keith E.

description: Stopped in before a show and the pizza here is good; just simple, good 'ol pizza.  It is a great stop for a quick bite.  There are many different pizza options to choose from, but my bf and I ordered half cheese and half pepperoni (I love the thinly sliced pepperoni that they use). I like that the slices are cut big and thin (NY style).  Overall, just a typical pizza place that anyone can enjoy.  Oh and they have some beer selections on tap as well:))   Tip: although the place is tiny, try to sit near the entrance to catch a cool breeze because it does get stuffy in there from all the oven heat in the open kitchen area.
author: Sheron D.

description:
Village Pizzeria is by far the best pizza in San Francisco. I've tried a plethora of pizza places and none compare to the delicious thin crust New York style pizza of Village. Amici's and Victor's on Polk are a close second, but Village blows them out of the water. 

Village Pizzeria is located on Van Ness and Sutter and has been serving the Bay Area since 1979. Village offers delivery as well as dine-in service. Delivery orders can be placed online and by phone. One perk to the phone ordering is if you are a repeating customer, you have the option of keeping your credit card on file for even faster and easier service. Eating at the restaurant is also fun because you can sit at the counter and watch the pizza experts toss the dough in the air and they often have specials. Village also offers pizza by the slice if you are on-the-go. 

In addition to pizza, Village also makes great salads, appetizers and pasta. My favorite are the spicy chicken wings that literally set my mouth on fire but taste so darn good. The garlic bread, antipasto salad and Greek salad are also favorites of mine. The peperoni pizza is excellent although it can be quite greasy. The specialty Hawaiian pizza is also a hit. 

Next time you are ordering pizza check out Village Pizzeria on Van Ness for some of the best New York style pizza in San Francisco.
author: Alice S.

description:
As far as NY style pizza goes, I gotta say, this is better than the 3-star average Village Pizzeria currently holds. You're not likely to go here for a nice family dinner, but for what it is, Village fills the void for quick and good eats around this block of Van Ness. 

Also on the plus, they offer a few draft beer selections and an endless array of toppings and daily specials. Where convenience is key, Village is king.
author: Monica S.

description: I've never had the pizza, but the pasta is pretty good.  Delivery was prompt, but you definitely don't get what you pay for.
author: John S.

description: Nice place to come and grab a bite, watch the game, or get a beer.  However, slices are on the expensive side, but I guess it's reasonable since they make it when you order it.  Seems like they just add toppings to a basic slice of cheese pizza and heat it up.  It came out very hot and slightly on the greasy side.  I ordered the spicy BBQ pulled pork with pineapple and it was pretty good.  Would come back if I was in the area and needed a quick snack, but don't think I'd order whole pizzas here.  I should mention that I really liked the crust.  It was not doughy and hard to chew like some places, but had a good crunch to it and just enough marinara sauce that the toppings don't want to separate from the crust.
author: Christopher L.

description: Had the village pizza special  be coming here for the last 10+!years it's was awful burn crust, the home sausage and meat ball was mostly pure ground pork, no meatball few pepperoni  just plain terrible,
author: Topp C.

description: Loved the non-soggy and crispy crust!! We stopped by 30 mins before closing and everything was super fresh and tasty (we ordered two pepperoni and sausage slices plus a salad) will definitely return again. They even offered Samuel Adams Summer Ale, which was the icing on the cake.
author: Erika U.

description: Very good food, and without all the hype some pizza places have.  Excellent place for lunch and dinner and for watching the game.  Make sure to leave a tip as the restaurant people here work to help their clientele here happy about the meal without hovering over you, and remember the pizza is NY - style.  Again, great food!
author: Thomas H S.

description: The hotel i Am Staying at recomended this Place. first off I want to say that the pizza itself is pretty ok, I suppose. I ended up paying close  to $30 for a medium pepperoni and 2 coke cans plus delivery. This isn't some "oh this medium is almost a large!" No,  it's almost a small pizza.
