Anyway,  the guy showed up here and was rude right off the bat. He shoved the pizza at my husband and asked him for a tip to which my husband informed him that he has no change with him and the delivery guy, pretty pissed, said "next time you should include a good tip!" And stormed off. A lady closer to us informed him a tip is earned and his wasn't. I was livid. Honestly,  the delivery charge should be more than enough considering the pizza is already absurdly priced.  I'm glad to give tips,  we are more than happy to give a tip when we receive good service. I feel like I want a refund because after all that I felt like I lost my appetite. The box is still closed.
author: Amelia L.

description: It's a decent place but way to expensive I had a chicken. And pesto slice for 6 00 that's crazy
author: Adam L.

description:
Great pizza, garbage service. Delivered us the complete wrong pizza. Understand this happens, so we gave them a polite call to try and fix it. Got nothing but rude even from the manager. Said he'd "credit us" which i doubt hung up on a girl and here I am eating someone else's pizza. Garbage.
Takeaway, nothing I guess just be weary.
author: Andrew P.

description: The pizza is very good. My husband believes Village Pizzeria is like NY style pizza.  our pizza is order in advance, it is ready and hot when we arrived. Customer is great!
author: Phebe F.

description:
The pizza is ok.  The service turned us off. 

First, the pizza.  Thin crust.  Good toppings.  Well cooked, not too mushy and not too crispy.  The sauce is good, not overwhelming and definitely not too sweet (I hate overly sweet pizza sauce).

We also got the anti-pasto salad with bleu cheese dressing.  The bleu cheese dessing was pretty good.  The salad was a bit of disappointment  Lots of cheese, some salami and a couple of olives.  I'm used to seeing chunks of salami and not thin slices on my salad, but maybe that's just personal preference.

Now, the Service. Our first waitress was awesome.  Stellar, totally on top of it.  Unfortunately, she got busy just as we were getting ready to leave.

So we waited and waited and waited for someone to bring us our bill.

Once we got it, we waited and waited and waited for someone to pick it up.  Finally, as we were gathering our things to leave a different waitress (one who appeared to have shown up late) rushed up to our table, effectively blocking us in, preventing us from standing up, and counted the money we left while standing there, flipping money everywhere and taking forever while she counted it TWICE.

Look lady, if we were gonna dine and dash we had AMPLE opportunity to bail while you were ignoring us for about 15 minutes after we asked for the check.

Although the pizza was ok and the location is convenient, we probably won't be going back anytime soon.

I feel sorry for our good waitress who had to share the tip with the idiot who picked up the bill.  Sorry, good waitress, but I like your diamond on your face, it looks pretty!
author: Suze C.

description:
Bless their hearts. They try they really do. They are not excellent. But they're not horrible either. 

I can't speak for the pasta but their pizza is decent, thin crust. Before catching a movie at AMC Van Ness we decided to go across the street for a slice. We ordered them to go.. Big downside, no "to go" boxes in an individual size. Really? You're on Van Ness on the cusp of a ton of clubs and night life and you dont have to go boxes? lame.

Our slices were put on a paper plate and in a brown paper bag. Can I just say I almost dropped my pizza all together because it was so hot! And the grease seeped all the way through the plate AND the bag. Fail.

I'll clearly opt to eat in next time.
author: Amanda S.

description: I need to try more food here because the pizza is some of the best that I have had in the city. They serve a variety of pasta and salad as well. The prices here are very reasonable for the area. The service is fast and friendly. I'm a fan for sure, I will be back to try more.
author: Robert H.

description:
I was here last weekend with a friend and we planned to have a pizza lunch.   We walked in to Village Pizzeria with all expectations of a good experience; delicious pizza included!  

We were aggressively greeted by an angry and long faced woman, who demanded our pizza order straight away.  When we spoke to her, she was very rude and hostile.  She argued with me constantly while I was trying to order a pizza.  I tried to order the pizza, but could not, because she constantly picked an argument with me; instead of taking my silly pizza order. 

I finally  told my friend ' Let's go somewhere else.' and she responded with a very angry  'FINE!' and marched aggressively away from the counter with a furious attitude.
 
I was astounded and blown away at how horrible the customer service behaves in this restaurant.  It does, however, help me to understand the reasons why the entire place was completely empty when I walked in there.  At least there's that.
author: Leslie F.

description:
Dinner tonight was delivery... The pizza was not decent, all the toppings fell off when I pulled out the first slice but I definitely like the thinness of the crust... BUT It was soggy.  They are not stingy with toppings so that's good... bad sauce.     

Literally, I just bit into the worst brownie I've had provided by Village Pizzeria.  Don't order that.  The cheesecake looks okay.  My friend ordered that.
author: Jessica G.

description: We got the Estafeta. It was ok. I feel like it could have used some better ingredients. It probably has a decent atmosphere during lunch/dinner hours. We were the only people there at 3p on a Saturday.
author: Gautam K.

description:
My friends and I were in town visiting and stopped and ate @ the Village Pizzeria.  The Pizza was awesome.  The chicken wings were great.   A Perfect Taste.  The good thing is Village Pizzeria was only about a 10 minute walk from our Hotel.  Plus we all enjoyed the Love Machine they have inside for 25cents.  Thought that was cool.   It's not expensive at all.  Great prices and Great Customer service.   Looking forward to stopping in when we visit again from San Diego in March.

Thanks again Village Pizzeria.
author: Junior H.

description:
Food is awesome. I had a veggie calzone and NY cheesecake. Calzone had lots of tasty veggies, mozzarella, ricotta, and pesto sauce served with marinara. Dessert was perfect, I don't normally like cheesecake, but this one I will probably have again. 

Only reason I'm giving 3 stars instead of 4 is because the service was pretty bad. The waitress initially brought me a slice of cheese pizza instead of cheesecake, no big deal to me, but she was set on trying to get me to admit that it was my mistake. This wasn't just a simple misunderstanding to her, she repeatedly told me "I asked you to make sure." "Why didn't you say cake?" "I know you said slice, I even asked you to make sure." 
I work in customer service, I know that the customer is not always right, but even if I can't remember our exact words when she took my order, that kind of argumentative attitude is so incredibly unnecessary. 

Food was still very delicious. If I do go back, I'll make sure to verify my order and take my food to go.
author: Elisabeth G.

description:
This is my favorite pizza in the city.  The thin crust, ala NYC, style is perfectly crisp and tasty and the sauce is not too much or too little.  I always go the traditional route - pepperoni and I'm never disappointed.  

Actually, writing this review is making me wants some...
author: R D.

description: Just had it delivered a few days ago and I'm not sure if it was the sun dried tomato or what but it seemed salty and oily :(
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
I've been ordering from here for 3 years, no problems. Good pizza, quick. 

I ordered a Mushroom & Pepperoni pizza for dinner this evening, and it came (6:30pm), and was tasty. Now, a couple hours later, I'm sick with stomach problems. I'm completely sober, and haven't been ingesting other food since, or 4 hours prior.

 I called the store (8pm 10/19)  to let them know something was up with the food they served today. I explain what happened to the manager to which he replies "I'm not sure what to say" several times, and tells me that "no one else has been sick all night', and they "have a packed house". He takes an attitude with me, as if I'm trying to scam him, or waste his time. Mind you, I've asked for nothing at all, not even an apology. I just called to let them know, since I used to work food service and would want to know such things were happening to my customers. 

I wouldn't have written a review if I had encountered some common courtesy, but this phone call made a relatively normal problem into a personal one.

Thanks whoever is managing tonight.
author: Max C.

description: So where do i begin? I frequently find myself as a customer of village pizza becauce of it proximity to my job. There hasnt been one occasion where the service was stellar. In fact most of the time it is sub par at best. I finally reached my limit with their poor customer service. I called to order a pizza for myself and a couple of guys i work with so that we could skip the wait when we showed up. When the phone was answered, I was surprised by the impatient and rude nature of the the womans voice on the other end. She quickly spit out some words which were unrecognizable followed by silence. Thinking i got disconnected i proptly hung up and called back. Again a woman picks up and this time tells me she is very busy and there are three calls ahead of me in the same impatient and rude voice and was commanded to hold. I didnt have a chance to respond or tell her before the line went silent. After waiting on hold for 5 minutes she returned only to tell me she could not hear me and that i should call back when its not as noisy. At this point i had given up on ordering a pizza. I would however try to call back later to let her/them know how i felt about their customer service. I waited until my break and try to call back. Not surprisingly the phone was answered only this time a male whom was every bit as unpleasant as his counter part. I asked to speak with the manager and was told they "we're to busy to deal with you" and to "call back later." I felt i had no other option than to write a review to hopefully get them to take better care of their customers. Needless to say i will not be returning to this establishment and its too bad because i really liked their pizza. There are many other excellent pizzarias in the city, i suggest you dine at one of them.
author: Ernest F.

description:
Whats great is you can walk right in and sit at the bar, watch TV, get a breather from the day, and have hot food, fast and they are very attentive.  I like their pizza and all the dishes are fresh, well seasoned and they take the time to really do it right.

The same family has owned and operated for a long time and they have the same very talented man making all the food and has trained all the staff.  

You will not be unhappy here.  I like it very much and the value is solid.
author: Craig A.

description:
LOVED the pizza.... reminded me of New York...
They homemade their own sausage, it was hmmmhmmm yummy!  It is surely the best pizza in the bay area!  
I always get it delivered, normally I like my pizza really crispy, so I will toss them in the oven for another 3 minutes. my delivery guy Noberto is awesome too!!  You gotta go try it out!
author: Rachel N.

description: Cook burnt my pizza. He was busy on phone, didn't offer to make another. Manager is super nice, service and cook horrible. I suspect this will close down within a year. Unfortunate. :(
author: Kelly N.

description: Before you die you have to try the clam & garlic pizza and the BBQ pulled pork pizza! Enough said...
author: Joshua M.

description: Great neighborhood pizza joint.  Love it for quick late-night slices, quick take-out, or for dining in and sharing an XL pizza in an atmosphere that hearkens vaguely back to soccer team pizza parties in the early 90s.  They also have a great selection of hearty sandwiches like the homemade sausage patty.
author: Megan K.

description: Stopped in after a Giants game on the way out of the city.  Awesome pizza!  And a great Caesar salad.  A little on the pricey side, but what do I know...last time I ate pizza in the city was in the 80s lol!  And frankly it didn't really matter, there was enough pizza left for two more meals for my friend and I.  Definitely stopping by again when I'm in the area, and in the mood for pizza!
author: Laura R.

description: My co workers and I ordered for lunch. We ordered the Village special. There was nothing special. I've never had pizza so salty and greasy. I would never ever order from here again.
author: Sandy P.

description:
DO NOT TRUST THIS PLACE !!!
I ordered Tomato Penne from the online menu. I purposely did not order a similar dish that contained mushrooms because I am allergic to them. There was a little slice of a mushroom on top so I picked it off, thinking it must have fallen in from another dish. After 2 bites, I realized that I had just chewed up a thick slice of mushroom that was covered in tomato sauce. I am writing this while I await the violent vomiting and diarrhea that swallowing that mushroom is going to cause in about half an hour. I called the restaurant and the owner answered. He read my order back to me and told me I ordered a dish that listed mushrooms in the ingredients. I told him I most certainly did NOT! I read him the description of the dish from his own website's online menu and he told me that the dish  I ordered, that he just read back to me, isn't on the menu. He had a frustrating, belittling way of  speaking to me as if I'm the crazy one. I told him to look on his own site. He put me on hold for what seems like an eternity to someone who has just consumed their most feared allergen and FINALLY got back on the phone and started reading the description of the dish I had NOT ordered. We argued more, he put me on hold again, then got back on the phone to say he saw it. He didn't seem to want to acknowledge that I had been right and that I had good reason to be angry. He also DIDN'T APOLOGIZE!!! He made me literally yell into the phone which I have never done in my life, but frustrated and poisoned, I had to go with my gut reaction since my gut reactions are all I will have tonight. If he had said "I'm so,so,so sorry! What can I do to make this better?" I would have said "Nothing now, but don't do this again to me or anyone else." Instead, he frustrated me beyond words and offered to replace the meal with what I ordered in the first place. I told him the last thing I need now is food since I will be sick all night from the mushroom and hung up. He's an idiot. I have ordered a lot of food from his restaurant over the past twenty plus years I have lived a block from his restaurant. I NEVER will again and I suggest you try one of the other, much finer pizza places that San Francisco has to offer. They can't do worse than this guy and they have never given me food poisoning.
author: Joni W.

description:
This place has been around for ages and I don't really know why.

The Pasta is OK but the pizza is sub par. Somehow it's half cold by the time it gets to the table and the crust is floppy, you can't pick up a slice without half of the toppings sliding off.

I was drunk and the pizza still wasn't very good.
author: Manny F.

description: My family and I have loved this place for years. Great pizza, laid-back (brick wall!) interior, and I love their mushroom-and-pepperoni with one of their root beers. I like their house salad, too. Great place.
author: Katherine L.

description:
Since I moved to the City, I've been on my quest to find SF's best pizza.

I've tried numerous different places, and am waiting to circle back with each of them one more time before reviewing them. With Village, though, I don't really want to waste my money, so I'll be short and simple:

Food:     It's average pizza...I had a slice of cheese and a slice of the Combination....3 stars for the food. 
Way overpriced for the quality, though, so I have to drop it a star...and I hate to do so, but I can't find any reason to give this place 3 stars.

Service:     Waited 15 minutes for my slices; guy making the pizza looked angry, but honestly, he was in work mode, so who cares....lady working was super nice as well...All in all, no issues with the service.

Overall:    Like I said; very average pizza, too high of costs. You may as well walk down the street on Polk and pay the same for a slice at Victor's....

Per yelp's description: "Meh. I've experienced better."
author: Farbod D.

description:
I had two slices here. One, the special of the day which was Hawaiian BBQ. It looked like they made a slice of cheese pizza before and then just added the pineapple, meat and bbq sauce. You could tell mostly because of how quickly everything fell off the slice, and the fact that the bbq sauce was cold. 

I also ordered a slice of the prosciutto special to go and ate it later. Big mistake. You can't serve ham to a large Italian man and tell him it's cooked prosciutto. It just doesn't work that way. Call it ham please. Slice tasted like salt, that was the only flavor. 

Nice enough staff and a cool inside decor, but really sub par pizza.
author: Tony C.

description: They have an excellent vegi calzone.  It really is my favorite, the only complaint is that the prices are much higher the last year.
author: John C.

description: Came here for a pre event dinner with friends.  The place looked empty on a Saturday early evening, not a good feeling but what the heck right?  Seating was nice, they owners support the giants and have a few of screens on sports. The waiter was prompt and attentive.. I am a pizza snob so I can't say yay 5 stars, this is not Zachary's which is the gold stardard for me, but I can say this place would be better than say 4th street pizza in San Jose, the pizza didn't knock my socks off but the ingredients were authenic, the sausage was not the school lunch kind, but tasted fresh, the pizza as cooked great and what I did like was that for SF this pizza was a great value, 20 bucks for a medium with 8 decent sized slices, My friend had an italian dish, which she loved, the garlic bread was "in the ballpark" and the place was fairly clean in the dining area,   Yes I would go back if I was in the area again.   4 stars only because there wasnt' anything negative, and not 5 stars just because it wasn't
author: Wil G.

description:
Their buffalo wings are the best on the planet. I don't even put ranch or blue cheese on mine (I never to anyway, but that's beside the point) they are so good just by themselves. Unlike other wings - they have a crunch to them, and the flavor is unbeknownst to any other wing flavor I have ever tried.

My friends and I always make our own pizza. Their crust is always perfect and always made the same. How do they do it?!

Fabulous.
author: Jennifer P.

description: There are two rooms. One looks like an intimate dinner restaurant, the other side looks like a pizza pub. I wasn't expecting this to be a sit down restaurant. You can't just sit at the bar and order a slice of pizza from the staff like most pizza by the slice places. You have to order via a server (add a tip for that). The pizza was a disappointment. They charge the average ($4 something) for a slice of pizza, but it's a small slice! and it's nothing to write home about.
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez L.

description: This is my Village eatery.  It is one block down from my apartment and it is a good place to eat solo or with buddies.  They have a couple TVs and a good menu.  The pizza is good but I find the sandwiches to be the best deal.  Great Spot!
author: Brian S.

description: I'm giving this place 5 stars because as a former New Yorker...well you know how we are about pizza. I really like the pizza even though it is slightly too salty for my taste. It heats up great and crispy in the oven the next day and is very tasty. The sauce is very authentic NY. Delivery may take a while, but I think it is worth the wait. Don't bother ordering an individual slice, it is too expensive, so just go ahead and order a whole pie. This is just about my favorite pizza place in SF after living here for nearly 25 years, though I also like Marcellos in The Castro and Escape from NY Pizza.
author: Larry K.

description:
My friend and I got a 1/2 clam and garlic 1/2 prosciutto special and the whole thing was sooooooooo salty. An amount of saltiness I cannot even describe. I didn't eat much all day so I forced myself to scarf down a couple of slices, but the pizzas really weren't good. Maybe I should stick to some plain ole mushroom and sausage next time I try Village Pizzeria, but I really don't recommend the two I tried.  

Service was like pulling teeth--I'm pretty sure our waitress was hiding behind that big pillar in the middle so she didn't have to help us....super awkward....
author: Stefi C.

description: Da bomb.. hand down. I'll go work shows at the Regency/Grand Ballroom JUST to get the cheesy garlic bread... Pizza rocks too... Don't miss it.. Cozy, lots of interesting things to look at, parking sucks of course but that's the city for you.
author: Bret B.

description:
This review is based on Village Pizzeria's Delivery.

I was able to order my pizza online, which makes things really easy to customize, although I was only getting a medium pepperoni pizza. Still, I like when pizza places let you order online. Just makes things easier. I received a confirmation call after ordering, but was not told how long it would be. Hm... guess I should have asked.

Got my pizza pretty quickly though. I can't remember how fast, but it was pretty fast. Maybe between 30-45 minutes. The delivery guy was very pleasant, and handed me my HOT pizza-- just how it should be.

The medium pizza was 8 nicely-sized slices. I was splitting the pizza with a friend, and it was perfect for the 2 of us. We even had a little leftover.

As for the pizza itself, definitely not the best pizza I've ever had, but also not at all the worst. The pepperoni is tiny, but they put a lot of it on there. They went a little thick on the cheese, which is okay with me. I love cheese. I guess there was just nothing special about the taste of the pizza. It didn't stand out. There was absolutely nothing wrong with it though.

Great for a quick option when you're getting ready to go out with a friend, and have no time to go out and get something. I'm sure I'll order from here again, but it won't become a regular favorite.

Also if it's helpful, the pizza came to $21 including tip.
author: Ashley D.

description:
5 for atmosphere and food, 1 for service. And that's how it should be. This reminds me of life in New York - Great pizza with service that really leaves you doubting yourself, but also somehow feeling required to leave a 30% tip. I ordered two slices of pepperoni, for here. The pizza was wafer-thin, with thick sliced, skinny pepperoni, the way it's meant to be. 
When the waitress set my plate down, I said "Thank You", and she stopped in her tracks, turned around, looked me right in the eye, and said "What did you just say to me?". I responded, "I said Thank You". She turned back around, and sauntered back to the kitchen. I wouldn't have it any other way.
author: Edwin M.

description:
*Delivery*

The online ordering is fast and easy.  The call to confirm and the pizza arrives pretty quickly.

The pizza is ok.  We got 1/2 & 1/2.  The half that was from their specials list was great.  The other half that with random toppings of our choice was soggy.   Can't quite figure out how half a pizza can be soggy.
author: brandie y.

description:
I've never been inside so this is only based on their delivery service.  

I'm pretty sure the pizza is supposed to be huge, thin crust, NY style, but I didn't like it. . .It was super greasy and not very warm when it arrived.  

I've also had the pasta (penne with a creamy tomato sauce) and it was great!  My friend has ordered the calzone, which I liked much better than the pizza. 

Delivery is fast and it's convienent for me.
author: Jenny W.

description: When here for a late lunch. I had the Antipasto Salad with a garlic roll and my husband had the meatball sandwich with a vegi soup of some kind. Loved everything! My fav was the house dressing on the salad.
author: MaLissa Y.

description: Very close to the NY flavor and texture, so 3 stars for that alone. Final two stars for always following special directions (i.e. going light on the cheese, well-done pie, making half with one type of topping/other half with different type of topping, etc.) having friendly, reliable delivery and dine-in service, and most importantly serving up some damn good pizza.
author: Barbara K.

description:
-- Awful!!!

I stopped by Village Pizzeria for some slices of pizza to go.  It was horrid.  I don't know what the problem may have been or if there is a new owner, but I do know that I willl never return to this restaurant.
author: Sun F.

description: Clean and warm inside, fine simple spot, but the crust was soggy even inside the pizza joint.  I can't imagine what it must resemble in a delivery box.  Where the flavors terrible?  No.  Just not great.  I give this spot high marks for a welcoming atmosphere, less high for the pizza.
author: Patrick B.

description:
Great Pizza!!!
Pros: As a former New Yorker, this is definitively the best Pizza outside of the NYC area.

Cons: Slow service.  The service maybe slow but you are easily able to dismiss that once you taste the Pizza.
author: Ari G.

description: This is the best neighborhood pizza and pasta in SF. I've eaten there for 6+ years and the food is always hot. I try something new almost every visit, and I always leave satisfied. Great service too. For lunch, get there early.
author: Parry M.

description:
When: Saturday, 12/6/08, right before watching Milk (such a good movie!)

Who: Me, BF, BF's BFF

Why: Because Victor's on Polk was being rude and we couldn't sit down if we were only getting slices. And Village Pizzeria let us sit down even though we were only ordering slices...

What we ordered:
Me: Slice of mushroom and a Caesar salad
BF: Two slices of pepperoni (more like 1.75 slices since I bummed a few bites)
BF's BFF: Two slices of cheese, a garden salad, and a soda

The service was great. The restaurant was clean and had a great atmosphere with it's brick walls and old pictures and newspaper articles. It's good for singles and groups.

I'd definitely come back again. (Note: If you've ever been traumatized by the Village Pizzeria @ Rincon like I have and are worried about trying Van Ness out, I totally understand. You won't be disappointed with this location though.)
author: Maureen B.

description:
We had a ton of out-of-town guests coming into SF for our wedding weekend.  We arranged to have a pizza night on a recent Friday night.

I made reservations at the restaurant for 25 people for 6pm, and when we got there, the tables were already set up.  We pre-ordered the salads and pizzas the day before.  Sue really helped our party out by giving us a voluntary discount for the salads and helped put it in a GIANT salad bowl for people to help themselves. 

Slowly, our giant party started trickling in, and before we knew it, we had much more people there than we expected.  Try 40.

Nevertheless, the restaurant responded perfectly!  The servers were really patient with us (a lot of kids running around) and kept our beer and extra pizza orders coming.  This despite being busy with the take-out and delivery orders from others.

The pizza itself was fantastic.  It was piping hot and the it tasted fresh.  

So kudos for the drinks, pizza, service, and staff!  A 40-person party on a Friday night isn't a stroll in the park, but they pulled it off!
author: Darren C.

description:
Let me just say this:

I'm from New York. I grew up watching my parents take a big slice of pizza, fold it in half and eat while the oil dripped from the edges. I loved the smell of a good, cheap New York style pizza. When I moved to San Francisco, I refused to eat Pizza until I smelled this place..

Great pizza. New York street prices. Love it. 

TIP: Don't try to complicate this pizza with too many toppings. I know, I like to complicate life too but when it comes to this pizza a good old cheese is always a winner.
author: Madhu P.

description: The general atmosphere was pretty sketchy, the food was a little overpriced and the waitress looked like she had just wandered in from an all night drunk but the prosciutto sandwich was one of the best I've had.
author: Ryan H.

description: First of all, a greek salad does not have black olives in it. Kalamata ones are the ONLY acceptable olives in this salad. Second, got clam and garlic pizza instead of the one we ordered. That's what happens when you don't write down the order I guess. This one was ok tasting, but SOGGY! They apologized and made us our  correct "Bit o'Bacon" pie. Would have been nice to have been offered a complimetary glass of wine while we waited, but oh well. Correct pizza was, not quite as soggy, but pretty blah. Gobs of garlic (from a jar, not fresh), good bacon, and a ranch dressing that one couldn't taste.  Went here on a coupon and total out-of-pocket for large pie, one glass of wine and greek salad and tip was $28. For that I could have had Little Star and a whole bottle of wine at home!
author: Leslie C.

description:
Overpriced, SLOOOOW, and not terribly tasty. These are my three bones to pick with Village Pizzeria. Sauce tastes canned, slices are small, and the crust is inconsequential, as I do not care for that part of the pizza. More importantly, the salads are chintzy and just as overpriced as everything else on the menu.

On the upside, service is excellent and the woman manning the register is a joy to chat with. It would be delightful if I actually HAD that much time to hang out and talk. Unfortunately, it takes a long time to get even the simplest order to take out here. I mean, even a slice takes upwards of 10 minutes on a good day.

So. Two stars for the charming company while I wait and the comfortable, clean environment to wait in. But that's where my praise for Village Pizzeria ends. If you live or work in the area, order from CPK down Van Ness and get your excercise walking to pick it up.
author: Autumn K.

description: Amazing pizza. We got bad service that was really stressed. The soda tasted like chlorine. But still the pizza was amazing.
author: Anders S.

description: I don't know about you, but I dig it. I highly recommend the clam and garlic pizza slice. delicious! i like the thin crust. The bartender should think the beer kegs once in a while, because if it's bottom of the keg, it's not that great. Our SamAdams Pale Ale was tasting rancid. We also tried the combination pizza. When we walked in, I was expecting pre-made pizzas being served to us, but they were made to order. Thumbs up for that. The mood, is pretty much a sports bar /pizza spot. not really a pizzeria, they had a couple of flat screen tv's , but i would've have liked it if they were bigger. But if you're going to a concert at the regency, then it's a good place to grab a quick bite.
author: Maureen M.

description: It was really great! The garlic bread was crunchy on the outside, chewy on the inside, just make sure you add cheese! I tried the antipasto salad, which tasted better than it looked. The vinaigrette is made in house, and super yummy. The brownies were to die for! Very chocolatey without hurting your stomach : ) used grub hub, and they were prompt and polite, although they did forget to bring me silverware. Will return if I'm in the area in the future!
author: Laura B.

description:
Village Pizzeria is about a 45 second walk from my office, so I am there pretty often for a slice.  It used to be a good, serviceable slice.

Now, they've raised their prices so that a cheese slice costs more than $3.  This is ridiculous when the quality is considered.  

Won't someone else put a pizza place less than a minute from my office?
author: Gordon E.

description: Great pizzas but the wings taste like dog food. The pizzas are 4.5 star but the wings are negative stars. I wouldnt wish the wings on an enemy. Nice friendly people. Solid joint all around. Incidentally, if anyone knows of a solid wing joint in Pac Heights area let me know.
author: Ryan P.

description: There pizza by the slice is terrible. I had a slice and asked for sausage.  The slice had no (if any) pizza sauce and little (if any cheese) and los of Bird like little piece of what was supposedly sausage - it was terrible.  I will never go to them again
author: john h.

description:
Hark! Yelpers have spoken and, lo, they have spoken the truth.

A pizza is not composed of a single entity. Like the Holy Trinity, it contains multiple parts out of which a pizza is made whole. At Village Pizzeria, the perfection to which those parts are blended is what determines how good your experience will be. I tried Village Pizza and found that its strengths and weaknesses are almost exactly what Yelpers said they were in advance.

1) The sauce: Bland and probably canned. 3 stars at best. If you come across a spot on your slice where bare sauce is revealed, by all means make sure to steal a mushroom or onion or some topping from elsewhere on the slice to cover that bald spot. It's the pizza equivalent of a combover, but desperate times demand desperate measures.

2) The toppings: Excellent. They have my favorite type of pepperoni -- the small, quarter-sized slices that crisp up around the edges. The veggies were fresh, too. Four stars.

3) The crust: Primo. Light and chewy with just a tinge of crispness. You can watch the chef expertly fling and flip the dough for hour after hour, so he's certainly got the method down. You better hope he doesn't play ultimate Frisbee, because he'd surely whomp your ass. Five stars.

Of course, I ordered a custom pie. Walk-in slice buyers might experience slight quality variations.
author: John G.

description: Sercvice was "ok", pizza was "ok". They were busy due to the Bouncing Souls show, but we were not even looked at by the employees for at least 10 minutes. Thin crust, hot and fresh was "ok". Silverware for pizza 10 minutes after serve not needed. Who the hell uses a knife and fork to eat PIZZA? lol
author: Chris M.

description: During football season, we religiously order a large/xl pizza every Sunday, usually spending min $25 each time.  We use their online ordering system on their website.  After you order, you should expect a confirmation call within 10-15 minutes.  Unfortunately I didn't get a call from them so I politely gave them a rang to confirm.  Instantly I am yelled at because they couldn't get a hold of me.  I must have mistakenly typed a wrong phone number on my contact info. I apologized and asked when I should expect my pizza be ready for pick up. Again I was yelled at;  since they could not reach me, why would they start a pizza without a confirmation.  I understand I made a mistake but I called to confirm before I showed up at their restaurant.   This person taking the call (male, didn't sound like owner) was so rude and not understanding of the situation. All he had to do was say that he wasn't able to get in touch with me but will start on my pizza asap. Ultimately I decided to cancel my order and never order from them again. Interesting enough when I said this, he quickly changed his tune and was trying to me nicer to me. It's been over two months and saving $250+ later, I've learned to make my own pizzas and haven't thought of going back to Village Pizza ever since.
author: Michelle A.

description:
Here's how I approach San Francisco pizza:
1)  Fancy pizza--I go flour + water or delfina
2)  Deep dish---Patxi's
3)  Traditional New York--- Village Pizzeria.

Really great traditional pizza.  I get pepperoni and mushroom.
author: Raman R.

description:
Ok, so I work in the area and eat here sometimes...I say sometimes because....1. The food is just "OK". Its not horrible but its not gonna be the best pizza or sandwich ever. 2. Its overpriced...a meatball sandwich and a soda is like $10 (remember, the food is just 'ok').
But the service was friendly and but the girl seemed a little confused and messed up my order...its ok. I'd still eat there every so often tho. But its not my first choice. Try the brownies there though. They are better than the pizza.
author: Maya L.

description: My friends bragged about this place and said it was the best. So when i saw a townhog deal for them i bought it.  The place is quiet and the pizza was good just nothing outstanding.. Maybe second or third best after TOTOS.
author: momo m.

description:
My slice of chicken supreme pizza was just so-so.  If I were a judge on Top Chef, I'd say "Good concept, but you failed on execution.  Please pack your knives and go."

I mean, chicken, broccoli, roma tomatoes, garlic, and green onions on a pizza??  I couldn't think of a better combination.  But the chicken was that fake, rubbery, processed chicken.  The crust was too crispy, even for me.  The cheese, sauce, and the rest of the ingredients were tasty, but for $4.50 for one slice, I want a bigger slice!  Plus, chicken is really the main attraction on this pizza... and I scraped most of mine off.  (When meat is so processed that you start worrying you'll bite into a ground-up bone... that is not high quality chicken, folks.)

The reason for 3 stars is that I liked the ambiance of the exposed brick walls, and the service was very good.  Of course, the place was totally empty, so who knows about the service on a busy afternoon.  All I know is, if I do patronize this place again (seeing as it's right down the street from my boyfriend's work), I will order a slice of pizza sans chicken.
author: Laura W.

description:
This place has perfectly passable pizza. I've had much better NY-style, and I've had much worse.

The pizza is decent, as is the pasta. They don't do a bad calzone either.

It's convenient before a show or a movie, and the service is usually pretty fast.

Overall, it's not going to be your favorite place, but it's an okay addition to your rotation if you live nearby and don't feel like going far and waiting forever to get a table at a top pizza place.
author: Jon S.

description:
Went to this place before a show at the Grand Ballroom. It wasn't amazing pizza, but it was handy, cheap, and quick to get a slice of pizza and a beer before a show. 

The veggie pizza was a little weird - it should have been called "pepper pizza" because that was what most of the veggie matter was but it was good.

Also of note was how nice the guy at the registers was - he was very friendly and not just a cashier-drone. 

If I go to another show at the Grand, I would definitely go back here to get dinner beforehand!
author: Emily M.

description: Ordered a x-large pizza from here. It was a chicken bacon specialty pizza and it was freakin delicious. The delivery only took 25 mins and the aroma of the pizza left a wonderful aroma in my hallway. My neighbors wanted some pizza but i turned them down. Me and my daughter tore this pizza up. I would most def recommend this place to anyone. Keep up the good work
author: Tareau B.

description:
I'd give this 3.6 stars...better than average, but not great.  Its a great thing when you can tell the guy how cooked you want the crust, I like mine slightly under so its perfection when I heat it up in my oven at home.

Having moved here from Brooklyn...I know Brooklyn pizza.  This is close.  But the price for a slice?  Fhagettaboutit!
author: Ryan G.

description: After living in NYC for 3 years, I agree, it's not New York pizza... but it's good, reasonably priced, and satisfying. Don't set your expectations high and you won't be disappointed. I order here every couple weeks and it's always good!
author: Victoria J.

description:
**Delivery Review**

Ordered from them for the first time via GrubHub.com. The delivery guy was hilarious...I couldn't understand a thing he was saying and I could tell he was the impatient type. Nonetheless, he made it to our door and the pizza was still melt-in-your-mouth good so not knocking them for the delivery guy.

We got the Village Special: Homemade meatballs and sausage, pepperoni, onions, green peppers, mushrooms & black olives. SO GOOD.

In terms of prices, not your Pizza Hut or Papa John's $10 pizza cheap. But it is gourmet so I'm willing to spend more. Medium pizzas (14") start at around $20, large pizzas (16") are about $23 and XL (18") are about $26. Of course it's gonna change depending on how complex your pizza gets. You can build you own as well.

Would definitely order from them again...and wouldn't mind saying what's up to the delivery guy.
author: Yee-Shing W.

description: So I called & ordered my pizza for delivery at 5:22 today (sunday).  Called them back at 6:35 to ask them if hey decided to eat it themselves or maybe they forgot to deliver it.  The girl that answered said it would arrive any minute. I asked her for a discount or coupon for next time & I was told the manager wouldn't do that.  My pizza arrived at least 10+ mins after that.  Wow!  Thanks for your geat customer service, NOT!  Enjoy my one star, I won't be ordering from this place, EVER...
author: Lisa F.

description: I love it here. It's fun to watch them toss the pizza dough in the air and I like that they make everything as you order - even if you just want a slice instead of a whole pie. Ample seating unless there's a ballgame on, and I love the later hours the place stays open...really convenient to grab a bite after evening movies at the AMC theatre, or if I get the munchies and don't feel like cooking. I like that they also offer a wine list here along with the usual sodas and beer. Compared to some other pizzerias in the Pac Heights area, the size of pies and prices here are very reasonable. Perfect crust too - not too thin, not too thick, and always great the next day cold or reheated!
author: Elaine W.

description:
Village makes a solid slice of pizza that doesn't offend my east coast sensibilities.  It's delicious.

But really, what's the deal with pizzerias in California charging $3+ for a slice of cheese pizza?  In NJ you get a whole large pie for $8-$12.
author: Rocco B.

description:
This is based solely on Lack Of Customer Service & Professionalism. I called in a delivery over the weekend, but the connection was bad the first time around and I only got as far as giving part of my phone number before being disconnected. Ok, no biggie just call back. I called and a guy picked up. I told him I wanted to make a delivery order and he tells me "Yea put your mom on the phone" Um EXCUSE ME??! When I told him I was obviously of age he tells me" Yea right put your mom on the phone" and hangs up!  Seriously, you have got to be kidding me. I call back and the girl who I first spoke to immediately answers and knew my name from our first call. She explained to me that supposedly they had a lot of prank calls. NONETHELESS, you do not answer an establishment the way that guy did. I don't know who he was but my phone number wasn't even blocked--you can see who  was calling. Get some people who know how to handle customer service!

* So dumbass that picked up the phone take a nice long look at my profile and tell me I'm a prank caller.
author: Lola D.

description:
What happened to this place? The Sicilian and the Regular pizza both were barely 1 star quality.  

I was very depressed as I brought a friend and was ranting and raving about how great this pizza was all the way from Redwood City to San Francisco

Years back, I used to drive from San Jose all the way to the Van Ness location of Village Pizzeria just to eat the delicious recipe.

Don't bother anymore...This place went way down hill! Too Bad.
author: brian t.

description:
I've gotten delivery from here to my workplace plenty of times and have tried just about everything off the menu and yet cannot for the life of me recollect what their pizza tastes like. It doesn't leave any impression no matter what it's topped with. Not bad, not good, okay enough to keep eating. 

Strangely their pasta is much more memorable than their pizza, even though they call themselves a pizzeria. Whenever news gets out in the office that we're ordering from Village Pizzeria, I make sure to place an order for their fluffy chicken ravioli smothered in creamy pesto and freshly diced tomatoes. Just what it takes to lighten up my day.
author: Victoria N.

description: This place is AMAZING! They make fresh slices to order. Hot, fresh, delicious, and the service is top notch.
author: Kim M.

description: If there was a half star option I would have choosen that. The absolute worst pizza. I was so disappointed. I have had the Village Pizzeria in the inner Richmond and thought it would be the same in Pac Heights. What a shock.  Not only was my order wrong I asked for Pesto sauce and instead got red sauce but the whole thing tasted like it came from the freezer section in a grocery store. I will not order from them again. And to top it all off I ordered this when we had guests from out of town and had raved that they were going to love it and then we all hated it. Such a nightmare.
author: B H.

description: We have a few friends that rave about Village pizza being the best in the city. It's been book marked for me for a while to try. So the other night when the hubbs and i weren't in the mood to cook and wanted to veg out we thought, let's try Village! Bleh, we were totally disappoitned. It wasn't bad - but I don't think i've ever had a pizza i thought was actually 'bad' but it wasn't anything I'd ever have the desire to try again. I guess I'm glad we tried it as we're always like trying a new spot, but village wasn't impressive in any of the tastes, crust, toppings, sauce, cheese all totally bland.
author: Audrey V.

description: Great meatballs! Love the sauce! Pizza is pretty good too! The owner was a sweet heart! She screwed up or topings on the pizza and fixed it by giving us two slices for free! :)
author: Aaron M.

description:
One of the closest to authentic NEW YORK SLICE in ALL OF SAN FRANCISCO.  
If you, like me, are an ex-New Yorker, and cringe every time someone orders some thick slab of mushy doughed, too much cheese and some pinenuts bullshit they call pizza out here in San Francisco then you need the plain cheese slice from Village.
author: Kurt S.

description: I drive 11 miles every other week just to have the chicken Caesar salad.  Here now with the family to try out the rest of the menu. The service has consistently been great. The dining area is clean and comfortable. This place has become one of my favorite eateries.
author: Ann O.

description:
Great pizza, pasta and good service for take out or eat in. They also deliver. Another dependable spot near where I work. I usually get the pepperoni or a spaghetti dish. 

It is never crowded...
author: Teddy d.

description: Decent place with room to sit and eat.  $3.29 for a cheese slice, its very thin though I am not crazy about their sauce.
author: Jeff J.

description:
I went in late-ish for a slice and a beer... slice was undercooked, the sausage and pepperoni had a past ripe flavor and the beer was stale.

nice owner, nice setup and close enough to home that I might give them another chance... but first impression was gross.
author: Jeff E.

description:
If you ask for garlic, they will KILL you with garlic.

Good pizza, nice service. Can't really think of anything negative to say about this place.

Not the best I've ever had, but you can sure as hell do a lot worse.
author: Andrew L.

description:
This place is great!

They make it the way you like it, crispy and consistently great. The delivery times can be a bit long if you wait until say...8pm Friday night, but worth it.

Calzones are filled just right and the hotwings have just enough zing.

If you are looking for place for your goto pizza joint, then look no further.
author: Chris B.

description: Came here on a Saturday morning with some friends for a quick lunch. The waiter quickly took our order and brought us waters. Our pizza and wings were brought out promptly. Nothing special about the pizza. Good, but not amazing. Wings were good, but not amazing. Decent meal.
author: Vanesa Z.

description:
**This review only applies to their pizza by the slice.  BTW I consider myself snobbish when it comes to my slices.

Having already enjoyed my fair share of whisky, my friends and I were heading directly across the street to the Regency to see a show.  I thought to myself "Oh look, pizza - maybe I should have a slice so I might keep the contents of my stomach in my stomach tonight"  I ordered a slice of combo.  The crust was crispy and the toppings were generously distributed.  One surprise I really enjoyed was that the bell peppers were cut so thin it seemed as if they were sliced on a deli slicer.  This eliminated the chance for the green peppers to over power everything else going on with the slice.  There was no excessive grease, and the slice didn't wilt in your hands when you pick it up like some last minute flowers you picked on the side of the road for your girlfriend's birthday that you forgot about.  Needless to say this tasty vaction to NY in my hand saved my night.  I plan on going back to sample their other varieties.
author: Bassman Z.

description: Its hard to mess up a pepperoni pizza slice and this place managed to do it during a workday lunch last week. There were barely 4 other people eating their lunches here which means that everyone else knows that the simplest of pizza slices is beyond this pizzeria's reach. Burnt, unsavory, dry, unappetizing describe the slice and the service. The coke on the other hand was good hence the two stars but at almost $6 for drink + (bad) slice this place isn't a bargain.
author: Pax, Formerly Known As Rufus D.

description: "Bipidi bopodi!!! ,"the great Peter Griffin, Family Guy. I went here before the Jaguares concert. This pizza was delicious, fresh, tasty better than anything I had in New York.
author: Noel N.

description:
Really?  Really?!?!  I'm sorry, but that wasn't pizza.  I looked at the clock and realized it was 3pm, a mere 2 hours since I had ordered the pizza via their website.  Now, I know that if you're a pizza place and it's New Years Day, you're probably slammed.  2 hours, though?  I must go back to the time for a moment.  You see, it damn well could have been 3am, and that pizza damn well could have been Mr. Pizza Man, and I damn well could have still been drunk.  Mr. Pizza Man would have tasted better, actually.  That was the kind of pizza you inhale without tasting at some ridiculous hour.  Unless you're eating deep dish pizza, a fork and knife should not leave the drawer.  I had to use mine, and I was none too thrilled.  

It was soggy, the toppings literally stayed in the box as you pulled a slice out, and although one of the toppings was allegedly meatballs, they more closely resembled meatball shavings and not actual chunks of meat.  The sauce was literally poured out of a can and the crust resembled that of a bike tire.  I had to douse every slice with Frank's Hot Sauce just to make it edible.  Add to all of this the fact that I rented "Harold & Kumar 2: Escape from Guantanamo Bay", only to turn it off some 14 minutes into the movie....what an unbelievably horrible film.  I'd like Village Pizzeria to give me those 14 minutes back, because even if it wasn't their fault that I ordered the movie, it actually was.

Save your money and order Escape from New York.  You'll thank me.

P.S. - I tried to post this review with no stars, but Yelp is making put at least one.
author: Ilan K.

description:
I have walked past this place more than 40 times always wondering how the pizza is. 
Tonight I noticed them on delivery.com and decided it was time. 
Noticing their prices are slightly more than say...Nizarios I expected more class in my pizza. This was not the case. 
My total came out around $18 for a 14" pizza. I got my order about 45 minutes after, but the price was $3 higher! I called them and they said their prices were wrong online. This is no problem if they would CALL you and inform you of this rather than trying to pull a fast one. Nothing was offered for my grievances, even though I explained to them I wouldn't have bought the pizza if it was that expensive. I want my 45 minutes back. 
Ok, I was hungry enough to dish out the extra money.  The pizza was not very hot. I had a pesto chicken, the ingredients were good but there was hardly an pesto on it. Now the crust was what really ruined the taste.  I don't know if they have other crust options but their hand tossed is horrible.
I will never eat from here again.
author: Aaron T.

description: I like Village Pizza because the pizza sauce they make is very tasty and fresh. Much better in comparison to, for example, Escape from New York. They also have very flavorful salads and pasta dishes, as well as good desserts. Their sandwiches and bread choices (they have a garlic roll) are dry and disappointing as well as their portion sizes. For the price, you get a very small portion of pasta when you order in. It's like the clear plastic container has a portion of food the size of your fist within it. I'll do my own portion control, thank you.
author: Michelle V.

description: I have tried all the pizza's people recommended to me here, then I stumbled across this place, and WOW! Great crust, fresh toppings, superior flavor, overall great pizza, the best! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
author: chris c.

description: Coming from New York, I am admittedly a huge pizza snob, but this place lived up to my expectations.  Nice cozy atmosphere, with cheap beer by the pitcher, and good pizza both by the slice and the pie.  Not the best slice I've ever had, but definitely a standout in San Francisco.
author: Jaimie M.

description: Their NY style pizza is good but the phone delivery service SUCKS big time!  I call the Village Pizzeria on Clement instead.  They treat you like a person.
author: Stephanie K.

description: The one star is for a moronic website...how the hell does their programmer think someone is going to set the time for delivery?
author: Stu S.

description: This is less than a full block from my house and therefore the closest pizza on hand-- that's why I've eaten there twice. But the crust was overly doughy and not as crisp as I like, the tomato sauce seriously tasted out of a can, and overall it was just not that good.
author: Amy D.

description: I tried to phone in an order, I got put on hold and hung up on 3 times in a row.  On my fourth try, I tried to get some information and the person on the phone rudely told me to "speed it up."  I just hung up on them and went elsewhere.  Thats the worse thing you can ever say to a customer.  Will never phone or come here......ever.
author: Milton W.

description: I did not think there was such a thing as bad pizza till I went here. My boss took us there and I threw away the left-overs. I did not even want to give them to the homeless person for fear of adding insult to injury.
author: Brian M.

description: My meat lover's pizza slice did not sit too well with me.  The one star is for ambiance: exposed brick walls, black + white photos of SF in days of yore, TV blaring, and the constant parade of MUNI buses just outside the storefront, which means there's always something to look at.  The pizza itself was greasy, the crust was dry, and I didn't like how I had to be "served" (as opposed to just ordering from the counter).
author: Zoe L.

description: Not as yummy as Victor's. I personally think it's too expensive and the ingredients aren't as fresh. In terms of delivery, get Victor's. In terms of eating at the restaurant, walk to Victor's!!!
author: J K L.

description: Ummm.... NY style pizza..... right... only if you've never been off  the west coast to experience real NY pizza and you think Noah's bagels are great too. Go to Tomasso's for NY style, or Zachary's Pizza for hearty Chicago style, but don't go to Village Pizza (any location) unless you want some pitiful excuse for pizza.
author: Pamela B.

description: Village seems to have stopped caring, at least to me.  I used to go here a lot,  because it reminded me of the great pizza I would get in NYC.  But the other evening they proudly charged me THREE DOLLARS for what seemed like a day-old reheated, dried and burnt cheese slice.  True, you won't run into this problem if you order a whole pie, but c'mon, once your customers no longer matter to you, why not just shutter your doors?
author: Richard A.

description: Allright, anyone rating this pizza low doesn't know what they are talking about. This is a wonderfully executed NY style slice in a convient location. Probably the best NY style slice in the bay area. Yes, I've had better pizza in new york and there is better thick crust or specialty pizza shops in the area. For a simple, cheap, fast pizzza with a well crisped but with the right about of chewy crust, good cheese, and fun pepperoni this was quite good. Service wasn't perfect but it's a pizza place, they were busy making pizza!
author: Seth W.

description: This is really good really greasy New York style pizza. But it's only good when you are wanting that really greasy slice. I can't even eat a slice if I can't dab the greese off and I go through a million paper towels before it doesn't look like it's swimming in it. But then it tastes really sinfully good. So a mixed review I guess.
author: Kristin S.

description: Hands down the best slice I've had in this city.  Grabbed a slice in the restaurant w/ a friend and it was crispy on the bottom, had a good taste and hit the spot.  We felt the slices were a little light on sauce, but otherwise very good.  Later that evening I wanted to share this pizza w/ my husband and order a pie online.  great choice of options.  For the issue of not enough sauce, they have a drop down menu giving the option of more or none.  For the crispiness of the pie, they have a drop down option for that too.  My husband and I enjoyed the pizza and will ONLY be ordering from here.  Its a must for any east coast transplants like myself, my husband and the friend I went w/ earlier in the day.  Good service to boot.
author: Heather S.

description: This was the first place I ever ate at in the city.  It was right across from our hotel and made for a great bite to grab at a decent price.  My mom fell in love with their home made vinagrette dressing.   Now I live here and order from them once in a while.  I live way closer to the one on clement so if I order online it comes from this one which is a little odd. Might be helpful if they had one choice for delivery from each location (other than the phone, but really...who uses a phone anymore haha)
author: Robin L.

description:
Its really too bad I can't give this place a better rating...the pizza is great!! I love their thin crust NY style pizza. This last time I went in, I tried a slice of combo and another of pesto, both were delicious!! 
The part that really backfired was the service. My friend and i walked in and sat a table for 15-20 minutes with no service. Not joking...I don't even think they realized we were there til one of the managers pointed us out. We ordered and the waiter offered us glasses for our drinks but she never came back with them. I'm not sure if they were just short handed that night, but it was a hassle for people that were trying to eat quick and go. Next time maybe I'll just take to go...
author: Jess B.

description: Once upon a time, it was five-star pizza, but then the original owner - a native New Yorker named Dennis - said aloha and headed to Hawaii, apparently taking his recipes with him. Still, this is better than most, with a nice sauce that's neither overly sweet nor too acidic and a generous blanket of cheese, and if you're ordering a pie and request a lightly baked crust on the thick side, they always come through.
author: Gourmet G.

description:
i haven't ate here in a very long time, but it does bring back nostalgic memories of my childhood.  as a child into my teens i used to work at my dad's shop on saturdays.  saturday was also the day he'd treat the whole staff to lunch; our pick at that!  

we would often order a sicilian pizza at village pizzeria.  i remember the pizza shape and slices were squares.  i would always come along for the ride to pick up the pizza, and would anticipate biting into the tasty pie as we took it back for lunch.

i have to say that i learned about many great restaurants and whole-in-the walls working in the city on those saturdays...
author: Sheri N.

description: The whole pie cheese is the only pizza I've had since I moved here over 30 years ago from NYC that actually looks, smells, tastes like and feels like in your hand a NY pizza. A slice even folds like a NY slice and just like a NY slice, if you angle it down, the olive oil drips off. The best in SF hands down. No contest here.
author: Walter W.

description:
when i lived in LA i used to go to village pizza on larchmont cause it was close and pretty good (and it was next to coffee bean). ever since i moved up to SF a couple of years ago ive always wanted to see if it was as good up here.

yeah, its true SF has a bunch of pizza places, and yeah, some are better then village pizza, but this place is still very good. just as good as i remembered. ive never gotten it by the slice, but their whole pie is always pretty consistant... even when its delivered (i hate when you get your pizza delivered and its all soggy).

but this place is quite pricy though. $20 after tax for a medium specialty.
author: N. B. K.

description: Best NY-style pizza I've come across in SF, and actually delivers to my house out in Potrero (Escape from NY, my 2nd choice, doesn't).  Floppy crust, lots of sauce, excellent if that's your thing.  Nice change from the spongey crust-heavy pizza with little sauce that's standard around here.
author: Evelyn G.

description:
I have a strong dislike of mushrooms.  This comes from a childhood spent in part with a strict stepmother who took great joy in making you eat any and all foods presented to you, especially if she knew said food was something you thought to be gross.  Big squishy cooked mushrooms topped my list back then and therefore I had to force them down.  Yucck.  Nowadays I can and will eat mushrooms if need be but try to avoid them.  The lady that works at Village Pizzeria seems to always put me to that test.  She is always friendly and seems happy to see me. Whenever she gets my order wrong, which seems to happen with alarming frequency, it is always mushrooms that make it on to my slice.  She even did it twice in one visit to me as I sent the first one back, telling her my slice was pepperoni, onions and green peppers and she had swapped the onions with mushrooms.  She apologized went back and a few minutes later brought me a pepperoni, onion and mushroom slice.  Hungry as all hell I just ate the  slice, and just laughed to myself.  I think she and my stepmom are in cahoots somehow.  Over time I have I figured out this is just the way she is. On another visit with a friend she brought us both salads, later cleared our plates and then brought our pizza.  When she brought the pizza she asked us if she forgot to bring our salads out.  She had literally cleared our plates thirty seconds ago!  She really does crack me up.  

And so it goes with Village Pizza. I get pizza from this place fairly regularly, I live right around the corner and it is pretty good, not great, but better than any other delivery around these parts that I know of.  The people working here are friendly and I usually get it fairly quickly and the place is a part of my hood.  

Also you can go to their website and place your order online, which is nice when you don't feel like picking up the phone.
author: Tom K.

description: Ordered their Village Special pizza and it was not bad. Just bypass the onions though.
author: Miles G.

description:
this was my favorite pizzeria when i used to live on sutter and gough. it was a short walk down on sutter to van ness and spent my dinners there on that counter tabletop. great place to catch football and basketball games on tv. i absolutely love their fresh ceasar salad and croutons. 

drink of choice: hefeweizen.
author: Mika D.

description: Apparently their other location on Taraval closed.  However, this place was great about delivering to the Outer Sunset.  Village Pizzeria has a very convenient website for placing orders and delivers all the way to 46th in about an hour.  They have yummy calzones, huge Greek salads, and delicious cheesecake too!
author: Tabatha Y.

description: I haven't even been here since I was a child, and my wife's allergic to cheese which explains why I haven't been back recently, but let me make this one comment. This was the place I was introduced to pesto pizza, and I think you'll find the pesto sauce far more satisfying than the canned tomato sauce in question.
author: Kit K.

description: Although my vote for best pizza in SF goes to Amici's, Village pizza gets second place. They make a delicious estefeta pizza with pesto, feta, roasted red bell peppers, and artichoke hearts. You can even get it by the slice. Since there's a Village Pizza within a couple of blocks of the AMC 1000 Van Ness theatres, it make it a perfect pre- or post- movie snack.
author: shoba d.

description: I've been coming here for many years. The place hasn't changed much (I guess that's a good thing). They still make a very good pizza with great crust. They deliver but I think it tastes best when you're sitting at the counter watching the guy make your pizza. They do slices (they're quite large) and full-size pizzas. I don't know of many other places where you can sit and watch the chef hand-toss pizzas right in front of you. It can be a fun place to come with friends, too. The place is conveniently-located on Van Ness. As for parking, you can try to find street parking in the area (good luck) or go to the garage at Daniel Burnham Court, the office/condo building next door ($). Service is satisfactory and delivery performance is average.
author: Al B.

description: I ordered a bunch of salads and pizzas for a lunch meeting in my civic center office ON THEIR WEBSITE.  That, my friends, is fantastic.  I love ordering things online!  Being able to order food online that's also delivered to my door is even more fantastic - nay, magnifique!  The food arrived 15 minutes late, despite the fact that the internet gods had prepared them for the fact of my order nearly 15 hours previous.  The greek salad was OK, albiet I've never found a greek salad that really met my standards.  But the cesar salad looked like it was 5 days old.  It was a disgusting gloppy soggy-croutoned mess.  Blech.  The garden special pizza was soggy and the feta not well distributed.  I didn't eat the others as they had meat on them, but I did notice they used those thick little pepperoni that sort of turn into little cups o grease when you cook it.  If I wanted to kill my co-workers, I would choose a quicker method than death-by-coronary.
author: Molly B.

description: i think this is by far the best pizza i have had since i moved to the west coast.  it's good greasy pizza like you'd get in philadelphia.  i'll eat here any day...and then need two days to work it off at the gym.
author: Hammer Time H.

description: I luv Irving Pizza on Geary, but have heard about keep hearing about Village Pizzeria so I had to check it out. This interior is lage w/ plenty of seating....this is a real sit down pizzaria. I didn't have a beer but $1.50 Budwiser is a REAL good happy hour...maybe next time. I ordered one of the specialty slices (I forget the name) It came out piping hot (pizza made to order). Lots of good quality ingredients and pretty good New York Style crust. Quality was good but it isn't a cheap slice. $4.88 for a single slice of pizza was a bit much to make this my new Pizza place. I would recomend this to be a pizza joint for entertaining at least 4 people...then you can get the whole pie for a lot less than $5 a slice. Overall, I would come back to indulge my pizza cravings if I really wanted high end pizza.
author: Angelo F.

description: Great consistent delivery.  I always get the Sicilian (thick crust, square slices) and it's always pretty good.  Nothing amazing of course, but good enough to keep coming back for.  Their online ordering system always works flawlessly, and I really dig the fact that you can specify "well done" as an option to make sure that pepperoni and crust is extra crisp when it gets to you.
author: Joshua W.

description: A totally average slice.  Their toppings are a little on the bland side for me and the sauce not quite tangy enough.  Totally passable, but would rather go to Victor's a few short blocks away.
author: Jeff R.

description: Best NY-style pizza outside of NY!  Cool historic photos on the wall.  Annoying teeny-bopper cashier.  But, best slice of pizza since Cheezy Pizza at Broadway and 111th.
author: Riya K.

description: Sorry, but I think pretty much all SF pizza sucks but Village Pizzeria was pretty good for SF pizza.  We ordered the large Village Special and had enough for lunch the next day.
author: Pelle Y.

description: I have had pizza in here twice and both times it was really good.  First time was before going to the Hemlock, which turned out to be a good plan.  Have some pizza and then walk over to a hip place on the other side of Van Ness.
author: Pele N.

description: Rough edges when it comes to service and there might be a long wait, but it's no-nonsense, the lady who usually serves us is down to earth, and the pizza you get is good. I do not like their salads though.
author: Hadley K.

description: I have eaten in their LA location and I have been a fan of their pizza for a long time.  I tried the SF location and wasn't disappointed.  I think if you like thin crust pizza, this is the place to go.
author: Lorraine Y.

description: Love their Sicilian (square, thick crust pizza) Everything else has been pretty standard when we've gone there. Nothing great, nothing horrible.
author: Karl M.

description:
I've only been here a couple times, but the pizza has been great each time: thin crispy crust and the toppings are pretty good. 

I'm curious about the clam and garlic pizza...
author: Fire P.

description: My visist to villlage pizzeria, was similar to the other review.  I ordered the combo slice, and half the ingredients fall off upon consuming it.   Prices are not cheap.   The combo slice and drink with tax come out to $7.11.   The pizza is made quickly.   I recommend either for cheese or meat pizzas only.   It was weird.   Even though I paid all this money for the pizza, they had no to go boxes for pizza slices.  They put it on a paper plate and toss it in a bag.
author: JERRY B.

description: Truthfully this place didn't even deserve a star. I went there today with my sister and nephew and ordered a medium half pepperoni, sausage, and cheese pizza. We also got the 2 meatball appetizer and a caesar salad. The salad was pretty good, but the meatballs were poor excuses. Our waiter told us that they were really big and filling before we ordered them. When she brought it back  to our table, my sister and I looked at each other like "are you serious?!" Anyways we were like oh well they look tasty. So we shared a meatball amongst us. The meat was tough and rubber like and had no taste. It was gross. When the waitress came back and asked us if we wanted more to drink, that was when I told her I didn't like the meatballs. She just said "o" and walked away. Later we got the bill and I asked are we still getting charged for the meatball she went back and tried to change the receipt. Another woman comes back and asks us to explain what happened and I did. She said well you should have said something in the beginning. I was like what? I told her when she came back that it was not good. So because my sister and I tasted the meatball instead of just turning it away at the beginning she only took 2.50 off. Mind you the meatball appetizer was $5. ARE YOU SERIOUS YOU REALLY TOOK HALF OFF and blamed me for tasting it? Wow... I will never go back there again. Service is horrible.
author: Meks R.

description: I will never ever eat or order from these people ever again! Just ordered a couple of pizzas from them today at 11:30am. At 11:40am, I got a call from a woman there who said that my order will be 1 hour. I said, "Okay!" Two hours later, I called to ask where my order was. They said it's on its way. I said, "Okay!" but will ball back in 10 minutes if it does not arrive. Then got a call that said it was being delivered at a different address (which was just around the corner. That's okay, too! Finally, got another call from the woman who called my at 11:40am to tell me that she never put in my order in the first place. "But they just called me from my old office that it was being delivered there!" So she said that THAT was another order. So...she said that she will IMMEDIATELY put in my order and it will be delivered as soon as it's done. WHAT??!? And, she will give me a 25% discount!!!!! I told her to just cancel the order. At that point, the delivery guy who went to my old office came a-knockin' to deliver this pizza. WHAT? I told him to take it back. NEVER EVER ORDER FROM THESE IDIOTS AGAIN!
author: Darwin D.

description: a decent thin crust pizza with exultant sauce for u who like the sauce this is the pizza to get!!!!
author: curt m.

description: This place is a joke.  I ordered on-line which ended up being a mistake.  ORDER BY PHONE if you are brave enough to try this horrible food.  It took them over an hour and a half to deliver.  Since I wasn't that hungry it really didn't bother me.  The wings are not good, they do not have any sauce on them.  Honestly they taste like wings you get at a Chinese restaurant not that you get at a pizzeria.  The deep dish pizza was nothing but crust.  I always get deep dish and realize there is supposed to be a lot of crust, but it is so bad that you don't taste the toppings. I'll never order here again, it was so bad that I registered on yelp just to write this review.
author: T H.

description: actually a decent slice... nice and thin, but crispy.  definitely a reliable option on this stretch of Van Ness.
author: Nat K.

description:
believe it or not, this is actually the closest thing to new york pizza that i have found in sf. the crust is actually crispy rather than the soft doughy mush that most pizzerias in the bay serve (and i am from here so i can say that).

plus they deliver to like anywhere in the city.
author: Mia M.

description: this place has served me well in my lunch hour many times before. the only place i've ever known people to talk about how great the plain cheese is.. and i must admit they live up to the hype!! The salads are always fresh and delish! give it a shot.. this place has a true san franciscan's stamp of approval all over it!! would subtract a star for a single slice costing damn near 5 bucks, but you get what you pay for!
author: maria p.

description: the pizza is okay, but their greek salad is to die for. if you're not an onion fan, make sure you tell them to go light on the stuff, because they give you ALOT of onions. the dressing is soooo good. i have not found another place that'll top the dressing. their service sucks so bad. they're rude- both ordering for delivery AND dine-in. the service, in short, is terrible. it's a good thing their greek salad is YUMMY!
author: Vivian Y.

description: yummy taste, nice pricing and variety.... i love the calzone tasty as well as all the types of pizzas they have
author: Len A.

description: really good calzones (which i find a bit hard to find in SF).  i also like to go here for lunch for a slice and a salad.
author: n. h.
